This was an affordable place and a good location.  It was not too close to the railroad or the interstate.  It will be real close to the premium outlets that are opening up in January 2016.  Layout of hotel was a little odd and finding the entrance and parking was also odd.  Bed and linens were excellent quality.  Nice workout facility and good selection of breakfast items.  Really appreciated the good coffee both in the rooms and the free breakfast.  Very close to the San Clemente beach trail.  A great walking path.  We will be back.

When traveling to San Clemente this is my go to hotel. Great staff and wonderfully put together fresh breakfast.. FANTASTIC!! Walking distance from the beach and so very close to the new outlet mall. Great destination for a perfect get away or business travel. Very accommodating for anyones needs. Definitely coming back.

Summary Heading: Just fine for an overnight stay.
Summary: Stayed for one night because we were in town for a wedding. Location was convenient for us however the room had a musty smell (Room 101). But the room was very clean. Luis at the reception desk was very helpful getting us our room a little early to get ready for the wedding. Thanks Luis!!! I would probably ask for a 2nd floor room as there was a lot of noise overhead.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel in beautiful San Clemente
Summary: This was a very nice hotel in beautiful San Clemente not far from the ocean. Very pleasant staff. The building was kind of a mission style. The morning desk clerk was very personable and helpful. And the lady in the breakfast room was very helpful also.

This hotel, like many others in San Clemente, have tired furnishings, fixtures and other amenities.  Location is good and it has good potential if someone invested in some upgrades.  The staff were very nice and helpful.

We stayed for two nights over the Thanksgiving holiday.  Very easy to check in-out.  Staff was very helpful and friendly.  The room slept 4 adults with little issue.   Just 2 blocks from the beach, and situated in the heart of San Clemente.  The breakfast room was crowded ( expected when the meal is provided with the room), but I was able to get in and out with enough to start my day.  Unfortunately had to skip the waffle maker this time because that was clearly the most popular item! I will definitely stay here again!

The hotel staff was very friendly.  The quality of the beds and comforters were of very good quality..  We enjoyed the location to downtown San Clemente and the pier.  The view to the ocean was great from the window.  The hotel provided a very nice continental breakfast.  The location was quite.

Lovely old school "Santa Fe" style hotel.  Large clean rooms and beautiful jacuzzi and pool area.  Lots of privacy.  In my experience, one of the employees at check in and check out was very unpleasant - a stereotypical guy burnt out on his job or not a good candidate for customer service.  Other employees on site very friendly and professional.  Wifi did not work with my devices  - unable to access a secure service.  Cable did not work properly…..multiple .06, .331, .67, etc. stations in between most stations.

Stayed for a weekend get away on the weekend I proposed to my fiance. Someone tried to break into our room in the middle of the night. We had the safety latch on, so they were not able to open the door (to spite multiple attempts of banging the door against the latch). We checked out that night and drove home. Tried to reach the manager multiple times to talk about the incident, he never returned my calls. Called both Groupon (booked our stay through) & Best Western corporate to report the incident and ask for a refund. They reached the manager, who said that it was probably just someone accidentally trying to open our door (even though we explained we were both yelling while they continued to try and open the door multiple times) and implied that we were at fault because we
Manager Response: I am very sorry about your experience at our hotel.  After reading your original email sent to Best Western I inspected the operation of your lock and verified no other card was used to open your lock, except the key we made for you.  On occasion guests go to the wrong door, and since your door lock was not engaged properly and the deadbolt was not used, someone was able to push your door ajar, and the secondary lock prevented them access.  I checked with the staff member at night who made all other staff aware of the issue, and asked if you would like new keys.  She informed me you responded that it was late, and you were tired, and just wanted to talk about this in the morning.  Just like at home, it is always best to make sure your doors and windows are locked and the dead bolt engaged to prevent unwanted people from entering your abode.  I do sincerely apologize about the events that took place while you stayed with us.  Sincerely the Management.

Summary: This fall was the second time we have stayed in this gem of a hotel.  It sits right on highway one as you enter San Clemente from the north. It rises three stories from the courtyard with a fountain and some lovely flowering bushes and palm trees.  Our check in was seamless with a very friendly desk man who greeted us and gave us instruction on where our room was.  Our room was as far away from the street as you can get, on the back side on the third floor.  This not a new place, but it has been updated.  The bed and bedding was very comfortable. The sink was outside the bathroom.  We had a double queen room with lots of room.  There was a frig in the room and two windows, one large one on the front and a small window in the bathroom.  There was also a large closet with full
Manager Response: Thank you for the nice review of our property.  I wanted to let you know that there is one more renovation that occurred for your next visit.  Currently we are only able to offer prepackaged food for our breakfast, but this is about to change.  Just before Thanksgiving of this year we will be able to offer a better breakfast experience for our guests.  These changes include, pre-heated burritos, make your own waffles, hot bacon & sausage, as well as our cereals, fruits, muffins, and other baked goods.  I hope you will enjoy our offerings on your next visit.  Sincerely Eric M, GM.

Summary Heading: A Comfortable Stay in San Clemente
Summary: We stayed in early October 2015 for 2 nights, a Sunday and a Monday. Our room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. Nice bathroom/dressing area with tub and shower. We found the bed very comfortable. This hotel is very beautiful in its outdoor pool and the courtyard area complete with a fountain. Good, nutritious breakfast. We would stay again anytime we're in the area.

Very nice BW+.  Nice rooms, good breakfast.  Plenty of lighting.  Very friendly, helpful staff.  Good location.  Can walk to town or to the waterfront path.  Nice size pool and fitness center.  Would definitely return and recommend.  Well priced.  The only thing we would add was a healthy cereal at breakfast, but they were in the process of remodeling and that could have made a difference.

We stayed here for a wedding about a block away.  The hotel was excellent.  Staff friendly.  Check in and out quick.  My only complaint was not firm enough mattress but I admit that I am very sensitive poor sleeper.  My wife had no problem with mattress.  We were on the second floor which was quiet enough if the windows are closed.  I think any really bad reviews should be discounted as unusual experiences.

Short over night get away with my wife. Check in was fast and easy. Room was nice, king size bed. the carpet was wet near the fridge and the jetted tub did not work. Did not have repaired as already in tub. Great location, easy walk to beach. Very comfortable bed. Room would have been great if the tub worked. Good breakfast. Easy check out.

Friendly staff, clean rooms and grounds and comfortable bed and pillows.  Close to the ocean and close to shopping.  Nice breakfast that included pancakes and breakfast burritos (warmed in microwave).  We checked other hotels, they were expensive.  This was a great value for its location and amenities.

good hotel for the price, and pretty good area - about 15 minute walk to the beach.. Some good mexican food restaurants in the area as well, and a bakery across the street.  Hotel itself is descent, clean, the rooms have everything you need.

I would highly recommend Best Western PLUS Casablanca Inn, San Clemente to all friends and family. Excellent customer service all the way around from phone calls to in person. Might even come stay again for fun We stayed at your hotel because we attended the Carruthers wedding on Oct 10 at The Casino

The rooms are very spacious, the staff is very accommodating, their breakfast is nice, and it's in a great location. Parking is minimal, but there's overflow parking behind the hotel with easy access to the hotel.

This clean property is close to the beach and reasonably priced. Ask about possible noise from remodeling. Our beds seemed new and were unusually comfortable. The heavy comforters that are now common in many hotels are inappropriate for warm climates and we were told there were no lighter blankets available.  Staff was available, courteous  and helpful.

Spent 2 nights here and found the room and service excellent. Breakfast offered good selection and served by courteous and friendly gals. Would highly recommend to business or vacation travelers. Front desk personnel very helpful. Close to restaurants and shopping.  Easy access to beach and freeways.

Room was clean, bed comfortable. Property older and less lush than I expected based on the photos. Would stay again, because the rooms were clean but no frills. Free Continental breakfast had things like microwaveable sausage croissants, fruits and cereals.

We accidentally left some items in the room safe.  Two days later I called and talked to the front desk person.  I was told I would get a call back after investigation.  No call was received.  I called two more times and was told I would get a call back but never received a return call.  Items included a credit card and insurance card among other papers.  I am SO disappointed.  I can't trust this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Georgeanne, I am very sorry we were unable to locate your items.  I know it can be difficult when our staff does not communicate properly with you after you had left items at our facility.  We did search your room and the safe as soon as we could, and were unable to locate your items.  I hope you will consider giving us a chance to make things right.  Please contact me directly and I will be happy to find a solution to help resolve this issue.  Sincerely, Eric Moser GM

Summary: This is the 3rd time we have stayed in this location. Clean, convenient location to the beach, freeway and other points of interest. We alway get a room with a balcony! We enjoy sitting out on the balcony in the evening. Well kept property. May be a bit over priced but we will probably stay there again on our next visit which is at least once a year. The staff is very friendly! We have never gotten up early enough to have their breakfast so cannot comment on that. Overall very satifs ied!

We stayed here for a friends wedding and were pleasantly surprised. We got the $15 upgraded king bed room and it was huge. Had a little couch, table, and kitchenette. For the price, it is definitely one of the better places around.

I stayed only one night and I did not spend much time at the hotel. The hotel is a short walk to the beach, which is not to impressive and the down town area is a short taxi ride. The hotel was clean and the staff seemed very nice. If I ever visit this area again I would have no problem staying here.  Tip Eat at Nick's, it was a home run.

The staff is great.  The location was fine for me, since I stay for business and do not need to be close to downtown.  There is a great burger place "The Riders Club" close to the hotel, 1 block.  There is also a Japanese hole in the wall "Super Bowl Express", they also have good food.  You are 2 to 3 blocks to the beach.  I normally stay in the nicer rooms.  If you are a Best Western rewards member, you can reserve a standard room and if you ask for an upgrade upon check in, if it is available... they will upgrade you.  It has a wet bar, microwave and refrigerator.  The air works very well!  Some of the rooms could use new carpet, but it is not that big of deal.

We just stayed one night.  The room was large, clean and comfortable.  It is an older motel but they have taken care of it. The breakfast attendant was very helpful of what they had.  We will stay again and would recommend it to friends and family.

Quiet with friendly personnel. Washing machine on site. Pool are was clean looking but I did my lap swimming at the local aquatic center (which was beautiful!).  Room was well equipped. I had the suite with jetted tub (nice!), microwave, and small fridge (saved $ on food). Breakfast was suitable (scrambled egg wrap, oatmeal, a few ceraels choices, some fruit, toast, and muffins/bread). Wish there was more bkfst variety as I was there for 11 days and it got to be "ground hog day"! Overall--a good choice in a nice area.

Some family & friends all stayed at this hotel because it was convenient for the wedding venue.  It all worked out extremely well.  I personally had NO problems with my stay.  It was extremely clean and well managed.  The Breakfast was very nice.  It is very convenient to the ocean.

The hotel has clean and simple rooms. Breakfast is decent. Hotel lobby looks run down. Most staff are helpful and friendly. Overall , it was fairly good for the price and the location was perfect for the conference I was attending.

set in a quaint seaside town, Casablanca Inn is a good choice, quiet location. Close to many types of things to do - rent bikes, whale watch, eat, walk on the pier, eat, rest on the beach, surf. or just sit back and people watch ;0)

We weren't expecting much and were pleasantly delighted with this hotel. The room was clean, quiet, and well-appointed with microwave and fridge. A salt water pool that was perfect for swimming laps, was sparkling clean with plenty of towels available. Complimentary newspaper every morning. Breakfast was better than most "continental" breakfasts, with breakfast burritos, cereals, and fresh fruit. Easy 2 block walk to nice beach with walking trail. Great Columbian restaurant across the street. Martin at the front desk was so helpful!

Disappointed with the breakfast, nothing was freshly prepared. Most of the items came from Costco, so not good. Pool wasn't as heated as I would have liked. The room was cleaned and huge. Bed was comfortable, which the blinds closed all the way, since the light came in, and I'm a light sleeper. Great area, walked the whole time I was there, and you can walk to the beach within 10 minutes. A lot of good restaurants to choice from.

The room was clean, quiet, and spacious.  Staff were helpful and polite.  Location isn't fantastic, but San Clemente is easy to drive around and there's lots of free parking everywhere including the beach, so that wasn't an issue.

Nice pool. Friendly staff.  I'd probably stay there again only for the pool since it was nice for the kids after the beach. Has a cute little courtyard to eat breakfast which was nice. Easy access to the rooms. Good Location. Easy to find.  Beds were uncomfortable, pillows were a joke..12 inches high. Spider webs were on the ceiling..cute little spider but he had to go....we also had a friend named Ratatouille visit me and the kids while they were swimming. Carpet was very very dirty!! Rollaway beds are not beds...they are cement with a blanket and they are $10 a day more. Bring your Clorox wipes to wipe the light switches and door knobs...just do don't ask!! They could amp up their breakfast for the healthy peeps add some granola and ripe bananas, etc.

Summary Heading: Trip to San Clemente, Dana Point and Catalina Island
Summary: The hotel is an older property but well taken care of. The room was up to date, the bed comfortable and service was above average. The neigborhood around the hotel is older and not a wide selection of places to eat within walking distance. The beach was about 5 to 10 minutes to walk. We enjoyed the trip overall as Dana Point, Catalina Island, and the mission San Juan De Capistrano were places we visited while vacationing.

This was a less than average "Best" Western Plus stay. The door to each of our rooms took considerable effort to open, and our TV did not work at all (did not even turn on). The rooms had poor lighting and spotty Internet. The hotel Staff and service was good in spite of the facility.

Typical Best Western:  clean, decent sized rooms, usual hotel breakfast, nice pool, friendly and helpful staff.  Located near the interstate, not next to the beach.  Can't think of more to add, but I need 200 characters.

wonderful pool- and spa. clean rooms..and friendly staff. nice breakfast and good coffee. what else can you want! minutes from the beach. cute town with little shops and mom and pops all around. great price for the area--- wished we could have stayed another day

Didn't know what to expect of a Best Western, but wanted a reasonably-priced (for a late booking during high summer tourist season) hotel that was quiet and away from the freeway but close enough to walk everywhere. This hotel fit the bill perfectly. We stayed on the 3rd floor in a corner room and didn't hear any other guests except in the common areas (breakfast room, pool). The parking lot was full so it seemed like it was reasonably occupied that weekend.  The bed was very comfortable, the A/C and fridge in our room were quiet, we had no problem finding a parking space in the onsite free lot (spaces for crossover suv-sized cars and smaller - there might be another lot for larger vehicles, we didn't check). Note that a 'spa room' simply means that there are jets in the tub -

Having stayed at this property for years, our experience this summer was less than stellar.  The only thing we ask for is a quiet room but that didn't seem to work out.  Not sure whether it was a series of bad luck or that the property is going downhill. Had noise issues 4 of the 8 nights we were there. Had maintenance issues within our room. The staff at breakfast was great.  Hope this was an isolated incident during the week we were there.

Just spent 2 day stay. The room was clean and large. I have stayed at other Best Western Plus properties, this one was not as deluxe for the price. The A/C would not stay on. The GFI frequently would turn off the unit. Sometimes we could restart by using the reset option. But, this did not always work. So it made for a restless night hearing it pop off and then up trying to reset. Since we were only there 2 nights, we reported to the desk on our check out. Hopefully, they will resolve the issue. The staff was friendly. The pool and spa were nice. We did not have the continental breakfast so I can't offer any information about it. The walk to the beach was not short. We did drive up a few blocks and found free public parking and enjoyed roaming around the downtown village area.

Every time I come to San Clemente, I stay at the Casablanca Inn and have been doing so for over 20 years!  The hotel is clean, comfortable, and the staff is always pleasant!  The hotel is within walking distance to North Beach and the walking/biking trail along the beach...

This is a nice beach hotel, it seems to be an older facility, but they've done a nice job keeping it up. Our room was clean, and its a quick drive to the beach or downtown San Clemente. They have a beautiful courtyard that our daughter went down to one evening to read a book. My husband and son weren't happy with the cooling level of the air conditioner, but my daughter and I thought it wasn't too bad, evenings were cool and with the window open there was a nice breeze.

The location was the best, good for beach and for Soccer tournaments in area.  Breakfast was more than the usual continental breakfast.  I would stay again if the need to visit this area arose again. Sells out in summer so you should book early.

We were visiting my family and decided to make a weekend trip out of it.  It was our first time staying at this particular best western and we had a wonderful time.  Our 2 year old loved the pool, the continental breakfast was great and the staff was very prompt and courteous.  We would definitely stay there again!

all teh hotels in the area are nice   but the casablanca has its own unique look and feel   room we had was huge very comfy  some rooms had patios and views we didnt have that this time but we were on the budget trip   love the location the shops had my wife busy a whole day and we both had some great finds

San Clemente is a California beach town with the usual attributes.  The Casablanca is closer to the ocean than most of the hotels.   It's well maintained on the exterior and our rooms were in good shape considering what beach visitors can do to a room.  The rooms were basic, utilitarian units, solid, but nothing to write home about.  The hotel is situated on a street with plenty of traffic, but the vehicle noise was limited   Don't bring an Internet device to use at this hotel that is not browser-based, such as Roku, Apple TV, Neotv, and the like.  The Internet administrator (Cox Business) for this hotel requires a password screen.  After a long call with Cox staff and a supervisor they indicated they could not work with the devices I mentioned.  We know that many families

Just spent three days here at Casa Blanca….son's wedding.  First, location is ideal!!!  You can walk to the ocean and beach in under 10 mins.  The beach also gives you access to a very nice trail that runs quite a distance along the base of the cliffs with nice ocean views.  Also close are a liquor store for all items, restaurants, karaoke bar, bus stops to get into the center of town.  Second, the hotel is very, very nice. And quiet. Clean, spacious (surprised because it doesn't look like a big structure from street), rooms are great; very large and spacious, pool is very nice, service the best, a nice sitting area with fountain, continental breakfast that is manned by a very nice, courteous staff.  It was a very nice stay…. I would highly recommend this hotel. Worth the price,

We moved down the coast from were we used to stay for a less crowded stay at the beach. We found this to be a great surf and beach place. Nice local place, between LA and San D. Waves were the best just south at the state park, Old Man's break was great.

Our young & older children enjoyed our stay as much as we adults enjoyed our comfortable stay @ the Best Western plus in Casablanca Inn in San Clemente, CA.  Thanks to the helpful staff, well maintained property, & nice breakfast we had a wonder-filled family vacation away from home.  Thanks!

I'm going tokeep this simple, since there is no point in going into a lengthy explantaion. I booked through Tripadvisor and found it simple and pleasant.   The staff are friendly and coureous. Although the room was fairly basic(to be expected) it was very, very clean. Pleasantly surprised.   Nice location- Short walking distance to the beach and short drive to the pier, shopping and restauraunts.   We did not use the pool, but it looked well maintained and clean. Breakfast was very good for a continental-Nice choices.If you are looking for an inexpensive hotel in San Clemente that is close to everything, this is a good bet.

We spent 2 nights here and enjoyed the free parking, low cost, and spacious rooms.  The rooms were clean and the hotel was very quiet. It's not in downtown San Clemente but it's easy to drive around SC and find parking, so that wasn't an issue.

Summary Heading: Ten Minutes form the Beach...and Dog Friendly
Summary: My ratings are based on this property's comparison with like properties...not the Ritz Carlton. They are dog friendly which is a "must" most of the time when we travel. The pet fee was reasonable compared to other properties. The room was clean and comfortable with the only issue the A/C unit was noisy. We were in room 107 and we were lucky to have a parking spot right in front of the room. The pool and spa area was clean big enough to accommodate 30-40 people I would guess. The spa was hot and the water temp in the pool was good. We breakfast down the street, but the continental breakfast was typical food which normally I would have taken advantage of...just had coffee. There is outside seating in the area between the breakfast room and the office that was nice. The best

WE come to S.C. to relax by the beach and also escape the summer heat.  The hotel is attractive, the rooms are large and have good amenities.  We especially appreciate the mini-fridge and the microwave.  The king bed is comfortable and has plenty of pillows.  Some king rooms have private balconies.  Those are the rooms we like best because we can sit out and look over the central courtyard with its palm trees and fountain.

Beautiful rooms, very comfy & immaculate! The deliciously heated pool was my very favorite it allows for a perfect view of the sunset & ocean. The breakfast was tasty too. Parking was easy & centrally located. The front desk clerk was friendly and accommodating.

Summary Heading: My first time at Best Western Casablanca Inn
Summary: My first stay at BW Casablanca Inn was absolutely wonderful. I  pre purchased it on a Groupon Deal. My husband and I were greeted by a nice , professional staff. The room was very clean , spacious with  spa tub, bed  was comfortable.  We stayed for 3 nghts.  Breakfast could  have been better. Overall , I would recommend it to a friend. I've gone back to stay 2-3 weekends since and luved it ! ! !

It is a total disappointment. We were at the hotel for a wedding. few members of the family were also checked in. Not a single family member have anything nice to say about the hotel. Price was way above the kind of service the hotel provided. Breakfast is just to have something in the belly. All you can get for breakfast are frozen food. Nothing halfway ordinary.

Older property, but I had a very large deluxe 'king-bed' room with jacuzzi tub, and everything was clean and perfect.  Room size was huge and pleasant and with kitchenette.  Second floor - window opened for fresh air, so I didn't have to sleep with A/C. Fresh air can be so much nicer - and quiet. No window screens, however.    Jacuzzi tub was great. Bed was too.  Room size was the best though it may not have been representative of the other rooms. Cleanliness was perfect.    Breakfast options weren't quite as many as sometimes found at other locations, maybe because the breakfast area was not large, but it was all good enough for me.  Price - not cheap, but nothing is in this part of the world.  Still, it may be the best value for a hotel in this area.

We had stayed at this Best Western previously and experienced a few issues with our room.  The GM, Eric invited us back and offered a discount.  We took him up on his offer and booked directly with him.  He offered us an upgrade and selected a nice room.  No issues this time.  The room was in good working order and the staff was helpful.  I used some Best Western Rewards Certificates for this stay before they expired.  The Casa Blanca redeemed itself and we had a better stay than our past stay

Near the south San Clemente's beach, about 1 mile to the pier. Confortable acomodations, there is a "jacuzzi"besides the pool perfect to relax after the surf or a riding at the shore, even the weather is cold. The breakfast could have a better assortment of sides. The staff was great, people very polite.

After staying in this hotel I sanitized everything we brought into the facility, absolutely disgusting. I will never stay in a Best Western after this experience. I would never recommend this unless it is your absolute last option, even then you would be better off in a sleeping bag on the beach than in this hotel.

I was very satisfied to be in a location just outside of town, yet still close to the beach trail. At the Casablanca, you are settled in between the State Beach and the city. The room was large and clean with many amenities. Unfortunately, I was unable to check out the fitness center or the pool. The service was knowledgeable and friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: 5 min walk to the beach he said.  Not romantic enough, too noisy.
Summary: This property sells out and they don't honor requests.  Their mediocre breakfast room has a tip jar... 5 min walk to the beach, 45 mins drive via I-5 to Disneyland/Downtown Disney; good south beach OC location near Dana Point -- San Clemente is undergoing lots of construction and is gaining an outlet mall.  Parking on the street was easier than parking in their hotel parking partially covered or in the open air part, parking lot was cramped and not well marked.  We were given a room on the third level, could hear the pool noise and the heating unit all night (it was cooler at nights during spring rains).  Proximity away from the freeway noise was good but this particular room was just as noisy.  Beds were firm and easy to rest on. Refrigerator and micro both worked and compact.

i've stayed here maybe 7-10 times.....really easy, again great location, close to good resturants........contenintal breakfast.......rates are reasonable....free wi-fi....good value....KING BED'S AVAILABLE..!!.....YAHOOOOO!

This facility is conveniently located near a busy interstate freeway and yet far enough away to give you a feeling of tranquillity in a nice quiet neighborhood with easy access to various shops and restaurants as well as the beach.

Summary Heading: Noisy, but nice location near beach
Summary: Guests in room next to me were noisy for one night, which didn't help me getting up early for a conference to attend.  The parking was challenging for large cars, and my room was not cleaned when I returned from one of my conference days.  I did like that it was close to the beach.

Spent one night here.  Had an outdoor patio off of room.  Walking distance to beach.  Great staff.  Comfortable king size bed.  Breakfast is standard continental with staff serving..  Would stay here in the future.

We enjoyed our stay at the hotel.  Close to the beach, very clean and friendly. It was a good place for kids too. Friendly people, clean and safe. Close to the beach. Pool clean and fun too. we would recommend to our friends. Thank you.

We actually got there at 12:30 and were given our room immediately. The room was clean,  VERY quiet, didn't hear a thing all night. The complimentary breakfast was good and got us on our way home the next morning. Parking was convenient and only a few blocks from the beach. The staff was friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed our stay there and would stay again when we are in town again. Only problem was that we couldn't get the bathroom window closed, but as we were on the 3rd floor, that wasn't too disconcerting. Overall,a GOOD stay. Would happily recommend!

The Casablanca Bestwestern is the best place to stay in San Clemente. Unless we stay at a vacation rental, we choose this hotel. It's very clean and we love that it is dog friendly, so we can take our dog! They have the most friendly staff that treat us like family. Especially, Arturo, in the breakfast room!

Very nice stay but would suggest asking for a room away from the courtyard and lobby where the tables are. Way too loud day and night. I felt like people were looking in to our room the whole time because the tables were directly across from our room. Tables should not be this close to rooms. Everything was very good other than that.

Stay was very nice.   Overall very comfortable.   Weather didn't permit outdoor swimming, but pool and spa looked inviting.  We will stay there again. xxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx

Best way to beach (two city blocks) is across street & down the side street that has the used car lot turn left not right @ ocean & train tracks.  I liked the room (very very comfortable bed, clean etc micro wave, small refrigerator & other usuals ) and breakfast sausage & egg sandwiches, breakfast burritos & other continental fare.  I'd say it is a mid level price range with most other less expensive facilities way under par from a quality standpoint so a good value.  Martin @ the desk was most personable & helpful he even printed directions to the family gatherings location.  One block away is a hamburger place that is named Rides Club while it is close and recommended by the staff I thought $22 for two cheeseburgers and potato chips (they do not serve French fries or onion

The only reason we stay here is due to it's proximity to a friend's home.  It's a very easy drive to and from their house.  We've stayed here 3 times and each time has not been very pleasant.  This time we booked one of the balcony rooms with hopes that things would be different.  Sadly, there wasn't much difference.  The same old shabby furniture and decor. Plus, we had to wait a half hour to get into our room as it hadn't been cleaned yet.  We got into the office at 2:50PM.  The only good thing I can say about the room was that it was quiet.  The bed was like all the others there: hard and lumpy.  We got up at 6 and were gone by 6:45 after a very poor nights sleep.  The bathroom had a Jacuzzi tub with a large crack between it and one of the walls.  Unfortunately, the shower

Summary Heading: The Best of San Clemente Ca.
Summary: We have stayed here several times a year for many years. We love the staff. We had the most wonderful room, quiet, clean and big. The pool is just super. Would love to live there. They treat us so well. Thank you , William.

Nice clean place in the heart of Southern California.  It's about a 1 1/2 hour drive to Mexico, about 45 minutes to Disneyland, and 1 1/3 hour to Los Angeles.  Parking is a bit of a problem.  Starbucks is close by.

Summary Heading: Great Value, clean rooms and friendly, helpful staff
Summary: Visiting our Marine son at Camp Pendleton. Very close to beach and restaurants. Rooms were very clean and comfortable.  Staff went out of their way to make sure our expectations were met.  Will definitely stay here again.

My mother is disabled, I was attempting to get a room on the 1st floor but they are all reserved as "pet friendly". It would have been nice if they could save 1-2 rooms for disabled people, especially by the pool so they don't have to walk long distances to get to the pool.  We had to stay on the 3rd floor to be next to the elevator.

Summary Heading: Some good things, some annoying things
Summary: I have read the other reviews posted here and I'm actually surprised to learn that this hotel has a breakfast.  We were not told about the breakfast when we checked in.  There also wasn't enough parking; we had to park on the street.  My biggest complaint, however, was the amount of light that was in the room.  The curtains didn't meet in the middle when closed which wouldn't have been a big deal except that all the rooms have exterior access doors and people were walking by the room.  Additionally, there was a porch light right outside the window that was on all night and was very bright.  It was so light that I could almost read inside the room with all the lights off and the drapes closed.  We had to take some hair clips to get the curtains to stay together.  But the room was

Always consider this hotel when I am working in the area.   Rooms are very good and consistent.  The area has everything you could want. Great food, nice downtown beach area with fun local flavor shops. The beach is a 5 minute walk.

We recently stayed here for two nights while in San Clemente.  It was a centrally located hotel - a reasonable walk to the beach as well as downtown.   It had the amenities we look for in a hotel: breakfast, internet, pool, hot tub, fridge, microwave,  and.... we upgraded to a balcony room, something we really enjoyed. We would stay here again the next time we are in town.

I needed some quality time with my teenage daughter.  We took the train and walked all through the town.  The Hotel was peaceful, the staff helpful.  We both had homewprk and the WIFI was excellent.  We also used the fitness room, new equipment and good air.  The complimentary breakfast had a variety of choices.  I am gluten-free and there were options for me.

The best thing about the Hotel is the location to the beach. The staff are very nice. The hotel is a little run down, but decent. There is a small little court yard one can sit down in and relax. The breakfast needs great improvement!

this hotel did have a decent breakfast and was in walking distance to the ocean. the rooms were decent but not above board. the pictures were not in the best of condition and the beds were just okay. the room could use some freshening.

We have stayed at this Best Western previously.  There were no issues the last time we visited.  This most recent stay the room we checked into needed repairs and attention.  The soap dish was missing in the bath/shower.  There was no hook on the bath door to hang clothes on, but holes where one previously was.  The windows did not lock or secure.  Missing parts.  This room was on the second floor.  Every time a large car, truck or bus went by the windows would move and the noise was bothersome.  Once again holes for the hardware but no hardware to secure the window closed.  The thermostat was not operating correctly and the cooling froze the room below the setting we set it at.  This room was not as consistent as the previous room we stayed in at this property or up to the Best

Summary Heading: Good Inexpensive Hotel Within Walking Distance to Beach
Summary: Very comfortable room.  Ask at front desk for a bathtub mat as tub is slippery.  Room looked over courtyard and was very quiet.  Beach is close, go north 2 blocks on El Camino Real to Avenida Pico, turn left and in a block you are at the parking area for the beach.  Pay parking, but free after 6 pm.  For a nice walk, go south on the beach trail to the pier (about 1 mile).  We had a very good dinner at The Fishermans Restaurant on the pier.  Although there were lights poles on the trail, they were not turned on as we walked back in the dark.  Would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel at a fair price
Summary: We enjoyed a 3 day stay here mid-week in February. We arrived early and our room was not done yet. The front desk clerk went out of her way to make us comfortable, pre-checked us in and got us settled poolside. When the room was cleaned she came a got us. Then gave us terrific tips for dining and local attractions.  We had a larger king room with a small kitchenette. It was lovely and despite the age of the property, this room had obviously been remodeled. We loved the extra space and comfort.  The location is great for anything in San Clemente, San Juan Capistrano and Dana Point. It worked out very well for us. We did have a Groupon so it was a bargain but would have been worth full price.

Even though there were several good reviews on Hotels.com, and yelp.com. . . don't be mislead. This hotel is unfortunately not in a good neighborhood, very loud - door was knocked on several times thorough out the night (among other noises/rumbles/bumps-very possible there is unlawful activities going on) view of a liquor store from room; waited over an hour for a cab.

I really like this Hotel a lot and is the 2nd time I have stayed there. It was just that barking dog that made it not very nice.   I still will stay again when I come back. This is a really charming place :)

Summary Heading: Great location not so great rooms
Summary: The room we stayed in needed some repair there was a basement door on the ceiling and the air vent made a noise all day and all night making it hard to sleep. The pool was nice and warm and there was a lot of restraints in walking distance. The parking was also a problem "not enough"

super clean hotel and very friendly people. I will recommend this hotel anytime to everybody. The best in the area. I will stay there again this weekend. It was a great experience. Best Western Casablanca Inn in San Clemente is the hotel I will be using for all my business meeting and family visits to the area.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel in a Great Location
Summary: This is a very clean, recently upgraded hotel property located walking distance from the beach and within a short distance of many fine restaurants. Hotel staff is very friendly, rooms are large, clean and functional. Complimentary breakfast (though quite minimal), internet access and parking top-off a great hotel stay and value. Highly recommend this hotel if in San Clemente.

Room large, clean, quiet.  Bed very comfortable. Good bathroom, very clean and excellent shower.Breakfast room was bright and good choice for us. After initial glitch, William went way beyond to correct things and make everything good. Like to thank him again and say that he really understands customer service.  Definitely recommended.

I have stayed at this location quite a few times and have always found it to be a place I would stay again. The parking spots are a bit small but overall a good place for me to stay. Thanks for keeping up the property, its always clean

Wonderful place to take my wife and 3 4 legged children for a weekend to celebrate 32 years of marriage.  Up the road at Dana point, you can get the best tasting strawberries in the world.      Nice drive from our house in Spring Valley.

Purchased a deal with Groupon for two nights and the place is nice, close and convenient. A short walk to the beach.  Service was friendly. the pool area is nice and what to expect Very close to the freeway which makes it easy to go to surrounding beaches, restaurants

Good price and good size room.  The comforter cover had blood on it when we checked in, but housekeeping came within 20 min to replace.  Marginal breakfast.  Liked the free internet, microwave, fridge, and balcony.  Overall not a bad stay, but you get what you pay for.

This was a horrible experience - the walls are paper thin and you can hear every word spoken in the rooms next to you, including the footsteps of the room above you.  If you want a good night's sleep, don't stay here.
Manager Response: Dear Brooke, We are very sorry you did not have a pleasant experience while visiting our property.  We understand you were here for a wedding, as was the other guests staying in your section of the hotel you were staying in.  We know that people can be noisy after coming back from a reception.  Although we try to keep our guests quiet, sometimes we are unable to do so.  We do have double insulation between our walls in an effort to keep guest rooms as quiet as possible, unfortunately they are not sound proof.  I hope you accept our apologies and we hope you would give us another chance if your plans bring you to San Clemente in the future. Sincerely, Eric M (GM)

Summary: Love the location of this hotel near the beach.  The keycards often don't work, and the internet service is really poor.  Nice and quiet location, good staff and clean.  Comfortable bed, and a standard type room.  The television service is very average with little to choose from.

Love the Casablanca, away from the downtown crowds and walking distance to train, beach and great restaurants! The beds and super comfortable and rooms are very clean.  North San Clemente's great little gem!

Summary Heading: A good escape on the cheap
Summary: Visited my friends in San Clemente - this is a decent motel - clean and accommodating - it's not THE W. Lol which is my fave but that one is 500 plus plus per night - so if you don't need to b catered to like a princess this place is good!! Close to everything and pool is clean and well kept!!  And you can have a free breakfast - toast coffee eggs (hard boiled) fruit etc so it is a good deal for your $$$$ - hope this helps!

We have traveled several times in the past two years to San Clemente.  There may be more luxurious motels in the area, however, we aren't planning to stay anywhere else.  The friendliness of the staff, as well as the comfort of the accommodations, always encourages us to return.  We enjoy the exercise room as well as the breakfast in the mornings!  Arturo always greets the guests with a warm smile in the morning and a willingness to warm any breakfast sandwich available! Thank you!!

Summary Heading: Great location, very close the beach!
Summary: The location for this hotel was fantastic! We were close to the beach (not quite walking distance) and many different restaurants, and the room rates were reasonable. There is also a super cute little courtyard type thing in the middle of the property with a gorgeous fountain that is fun to sit in, and I was fascinated by the cute bubbly fountain in the lobby. Although this hotel was good and I would definitely stay here again and even recommend it to others, I do not think this hotel deserves the title of a Best Western Plus. I've worked at a Best Western before (no longer at a Best Western, but another property) and am familiar with the requirements needed to be a plus hotel, but I honestly think the requirements need to change, as there are certain things about this plus

Very cute clean hotel. It was odd but I would stay again in a heartbeat. Not walking distance to beach but in a good near downtown area. There is a liquor store across the street and many auto shops behind but it felt Very safe. Outdoor entrances face a courtyard. Quieter than expected. You can hear roller suitcases and the maid carts but they are easy to sleep though. It was almost so quiet (in Dec) I couldn't sleep. Large rooms but in So Cal they are humid, run your bathroom fan. Windows also open. Friendly staff, soft pillows, many cable TV channels. The odd parts: I had no toiletries in my room, not even a bar of soap. Not sure if this was an over site or a cost saving thing. I pack my own toiletries so it did not bother me any. Basic breakfast. Muffins, Bagels, Juice,

Hotel was very close to Camp Pendleton! Close to many restaurants. Very close to San Clemente Beach which as a very nice Semper Fi Park over looking the water. Restaurant on the pier was very nice. Beach was very clean.

Close to beach and a few thrift stores that had good deals. Stores not far away for last minute snacks and forgetful items. The weather was nice and taking walks is highly recommended. The pool and fitness center is a big plus for enjoying a weekend getaway.

This hotel was very clean and the person at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. The location was also great, it's right next to the beach and all the shops. I would definitely stay here again.

This hotel has nice, comfortable rooms and great staff. My room had a private balcony which was so nice to sit out on and enjoy the beautiful weather. It is in a convenient location...there are a couple of food places within walking distance. The beach is about a mile away.

Our visit to San Clemente for a visit with our daughter was a most pleasant experience.  Not only were we close to the ocean but the hotel is located on a street that is full of restaurants and shops with the heart of downtown not to far away.  Will definitely stay here again when visiting San Clemente!!

I've stayed at the BW Casablanca several times and each time it has been a good experience. I used this hotel to host a night for our large tour group. The staff has always been extremely helpful and the hotel rooms very clean.  The location in San Clemente on PCH is a plus!   Only minor drawback is the continental breakfast - lots of food, but could use a pancake or waffle machine. Will definitely be back again sometime!

I've been coming here for the past five or so years and find it an excellent place to stay. Staff invariably attentive , courteous and helpful. Good public transport links (bus and Metrolink trains) within easy walking distance. JW., United Kingdom.

Stayed here 3 nights as we had a slab leak at our home.  Everything was as anticipated.  Room was neat and clean, decent size and pool was of good size.  The only drawback was the breakfast which was minimal with no hot items.

We arrived at the hotel around 12 midnight.  Staff were still available and we were able to get our key and go right up to our room.  The room was well furnished, the bed was comfortable and we had no complaints about cleanliness.

Summary Heading: Great location,very thoughtful and hospitable general manager
Summary: We had reserved two nights for a birthday weekend and our deluxe room (third floor view) was unavailable due to a wedding party guest with a dog the night before going a bit wild made it unsuitable.  The GM tried to call me to let me know, yet I must have given him my wrong number.  He gave us a king size room for $90 a  night and then on Saturday night i found a huge bouquet of flowers (looked like fresh from a farmer's market.)  He also patiently drew out his favorite beach and where the hiking trail was.  I would come back for his hospitality.  The pool is saline and at a very pleasant temperature.  Lounge chairs abound.  Small hot tub that is hot with good bubbles.  The free breakfast is a basic continental breakfast - lots of carbs.  Glad that also had hard boiled eggs and

Summary Heading: clean, convenient, comfortable, aand well priced
Summary: We just slept there, nothing more.  It was comfortable.  The decor is not as nice as at other BW Pluses that we've stayed at, but quite acceptable.  A short drive to the pier for lunch, which factored into my choice.  Quiet area.  I didn't notice anything within walking distance, such as restaurants, but then, I wasn't looking.

This town is amazing and so is this hotel.  Nice, quiet, clean, and close to everything.  Hot water, good water pressure, clean, fresh rooms. Parking kind of tricky but not a big deal. View from 3rd floor priceless.

This was a great little hotel. The room was clean, nicely decorated and well kept. The continental breakfast was well apportioned and the staff was friendly and helpful. it was perfect for what we needed, a basic home base for our local travels.

Needed a break from Anaheim, popped in here for the night. Staff were very helpful, room clean and large. Had a complimentary breakfast that was so fun chatting to all the other guests, this hotel ticks all the boxes.

Summary Heading: Where nothing else matters except the Location
Summary: The hotel is situated at a crossroad. The inner court multiples the noise of guests coming and going and their conversations. Our room opened to this inner court as obviously did many others. Therefore it was a little bit noisy at night although we did not have the impression as if there was big partying.  The hotel structure is of an old fashioned motel but our guestroom was nicely rebuilt and modernized. There is also a gated pool area. Limited parking is available under the hotel rooms on the ground level (and insofar covered) or with space enough around the corner at the hotel's backdoor. It's a little bit a maze to find from there the way back to the elevator.  The business center is on an accommodation floor. You need a separate key card which works only once. If you have

My husband and I had an overnight stay at this hotel on our trip down highway 1 from San Francisco to San Diego.  We had a large spacious clean room but it was a little tired and dated.  In the evening we walked ten minutes to the beach and enjoyed a beautiful sunset. The breakfast that was included was basic but alright. Just OK for a one night stay, we weren't sorry to be moving on.

Casablanca Inn is a well maintained hotel in a great location.  It's only a few blocks away from San Clemente beaches.  The rooms are nice and beds were comfortable for us.  Also they put out a nice choice of light breakfast foods.  We would stay there again.

We have stayed here many times and always stay at least 4 days. It is a pretty hotel. Nice landscaping, pretty courtyard area. Love the pool area. Staff are attentive and helpful. Breakfast could be improved on. Good overall value for the money. Would stay again and again.

Just spent 2 wonderful days/nights at Casablanca Inn and had a wonderful stay. The staff was super nice, non intrusive, rooms are very clean and the courtyard is great to use when you want to enjoy the California weather. The pool is nice with jacuzzi.

Looks like it was recently remodeled.  No mold or damp smell as is common in many beach hotels.  Nice pool and spa that is very well maintained.  It is a 5 minute walk to the beach.  It is pet friendly, but you would never know it as it is very well maintained.  Will definitely go back for another short vacation.

Summary Heading: Like heaven, but with limited breakfast options.
Summary: We stayed on a Sunday night, so maybe we missed the crowd. But this place was terrific: huge room, unique architecture, incredibly quiet (again, on a rainy Sunday night), and everything worked. And, considering the market, very reasonably priced.   For once, I'll let the otherwise perfect experience override a glaring flaw: here, nothing you'd want to cal 'breakfast' in the morning. Fortunately, we were seeing friends in town for breakfast, but otherwise it would have been Sausage McMuffins and Senior Coffee, black.

Great location about 3/4 mile to the beach and 1 mile to downtown.  Well received amenities.  All that were advertised were exactly what they claimed.  We would definitely stay again.  Great staff, great service, great time.

Summary Heading: Not a good choice for us
Summary: Outdated rooms; air conditioner needed replacement; ants in several rooms; no TV guide, emergency or welcome info in room; carpet filthy; uncomfortable pillows; workout room poor. ADA room not acceptable for handicapped.

I would recommend this Hotel because of the value and room cleanliness.  The deluxe room had a mini kitchenette with a sink, fridge and microwave.  The room was large and had a fold out couch if you wanted to bring along your kids.  The King size bed was comfortable although a couple flatter pillows would have been nice. Pillows were a bit too plump for me.  There is a nice walk to the beach of two Blks and then you can walk down toward the San Clemente Pier by catching a walkway that goes along the sea.  Really is quite beautiful and the price is right.

loved the location.  breakfast was awesome!  great variety, impressive. some gnats and ants in the room. i would go back and stay here though. great area.  felt very safe there too. my kids loved the salt water pool.

Three generations of our family spent 2 nights at this hotel.  It was a perfect place for a family get away.  The pool area was probably the favorite place.  The hot tub was very hot.  Too hot for children.  They had an outdoor grill and plenty of tables plus lounge chairs.  The rooms were clean, roomy and quiet.  We were probably the noisy ones!  The location was enough away from the main part of town that we didn't get a lot of traffic.  I can see how parking could be difficult if there is an event in their conference room.  Breakfast was good with many choices.  I would go here again.

Cons: Parking is tight, not great for large vehicles and spaces limited especially when fellow travelers take more than one parking space.  Pros: clean room, comfortable bed, spacious bathroom, accommodating staff.  We arrived early and were able to check in at around 11 am as part of our reservation request. Our room had a balcony overlooking the courtyard with the fountain and was so peaceful and relaxing. This property is pet friendly as I later found so my next stay will be with my dogs, definitely will return!

Hotel looks good inside and the rooms were spacious and clean. Parking not easy to find and b-fast was not great. Room was too tiny, limited choice e.g no hot milk or apple / orange juice left and staff eager to clean up and close room.

I tried to get a hotel on the 4th of July and everything was booked I found a room at the Casablanca Inn, while booking I thought the rates to be a bit higher than the norm, but we wanted a getaway so I booked it.  When we got there other than the location we were very happy, with the room & service. We had 2 small problems but they were taken care of quicker than fast

Summary Heading: 3.5* - clean, comfortable, close to the beach.
Summary: I was a little concerned when discovering our room was just off the front entrance around the corner from the swimming pool, the breakfast room, and just off the courtyard.  It was quite dark despite a large window.   That said, it was quiet, well soundproofed and I virtually heard nothing from the neighbours except a bath running, even though the hotel was full for the three nights we were there.  It was spotlessly clean, with 2 comfy queen beds.  I like hotels where the sink is outside the bathroom - much easier when 4 are sharing a room.  The lobby staff were friendly and helpful, recommending local restaurants when asked.  The fridge worked well.  There was a microwave which we didn't use. Wi-Fi was a bit spotty and slow.  Apparently it exists in the north building, but not

We stayed at the Best Western Casablanca a couple of weeks ago. It is located in San Clemente, California on Del Mar, which is one of the main avenues in that city.   This is a lovely hotel with large rooms. We even fit a rollaway bed in our room with no problem. There is a small fridge and coffee maker as well. One of the extra nice touches of this hotel is that the rooms are decorated so nicely. They have even included wallpaper trim at the top of the room near the ceiling giving it a cozy feeling.   The breakfast room was located near the pool. It featured several nice choices for a light continental breakfast.  There is a central patio area with a fountain, plants, tables and umbrellas. I have seen guests gathering here to socialize.   The parking lot is a bit tight and can

Summary Heading: Beatiful Place to relax after a long day
Summary: Great location the place is very inviting for relaxing after a long day, the have la large fountain next to some tables and chairs great to just seat relax and read the paper. Rooms are a good size very quiet

Lovely hotel with unusual design,close to beaches, but with a large pool. Our room was very clean, well decorated and included a private balcony,  The staff were helpful and courteous at all times, even when I lost my room key.

Summary Heading: Good Hotel near San Clemente beach
Summary: . Very close to San Clemente beach. A nice clean hotel We traveled with kids and this hotel was excelent choice. The hotel staff was very friendly. My kids had a blast with the swimming pool and the beach. We stayed 4 nights. We would stay again.

I had a great stay at Best Western in San Clemente. It was recommended by a friend. I was travelling by myself and wanted a safe and convenient place to stay in the San Clemente/Dana Point area. Loved that it was closed to Avenieda Del Mar for some great restaurants. I would stay here again. Friendly staff.

Clean and comfortable! Close to the beach, bike rentals and pier. Good light continental breakfast. The small court yard was relaxing for my husband to take work calls and drink his morning coffee. The Staff was very friendly and I appreciated the front desk employee being professional and accommodating. We enjoyed our two night stay over the 4th if July. Would definitely stay again.

finally a place thaT has it all,,close to the beach,,close to town and walkable..with clean rooms and a great staff at a good price. this is the place with kids , solo or on a date with your loved ones.

Summary Heading: Wedding to go to ,closest to Venue
Summary: The hotel or motel was closest to the Venue to the wedding , 5 min walk. that was the main consideration .Price in my opinion was very high for this level of hotel .that was the man consideration . Several families going to the wedding stayed, here, and The Brides family had a catered brunch the next morning in the Banquet room

The way the hotel is designed, the rooms are above the parking.  At 6:15 a.m., a woman started her rental car's alarm -- and couldn't get it turned off (lessons should be mandatory by the rental companies).  I went to our balcony and could almost look directly down on the offending car.  I was getting ready to go down to stop this horrible noise, another guest came and quieted the alarm in about 5 seconds. I did think the room was nice (although a little bare) and the bathroom was very good.  I did like the swimming pool too.  I thought the breakfast was decidedly so, however.  If it hadn't been for being awakened so early -- not the hotel's fault but exacerbated by the hotel design -- I would given this hotel four stars.

Summary Heading: Nice stay close to the beach
Summary: Nice staff, clean rooms, but nothing fancy.  No view (at least from most rooms).  Good restaurants and shopping nearby.  The beaches are not the best for family swimming (better for surfers).  I was unhappy to find a staff member adding chemicals to the jacuzzi at 4:30 in the afternoon.  He should do it after the pool closes for the night.  At 9 the next morning, the pool was being vacuumed and the jacuzzi being refilled...so again could not use for 45 minutes.  This is unacceptable.  Nice continental breakfast, but for some reason many of the items had to be requested from a staff member behind the counter which was a hassle as it caused a line.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review,  I apologize about having to add chemicals to the Jacuzzi so late in the day.  Typically the chemicals are set every other day at 6:30am.  The time you were here however, our maintenance staff noticed the Jacuzzi was not it typical sparkling blue color.  Apparently, our chlorine feeder had become clogged and was not chlorinating the Jacuzzi properly.  This is something that can cause problems, so we had to bring the chlorine level up to par in order to keep the Jacuzzi clean and safe for our visitors.  We really appreciate you coming to stay with us, and hopefully this issue will not arise if you decide to stay with us again.  Sincerely, Eric Moser

Summary: clean hotel,professional staff,breakfast wonderful,nice ammenities,great swimming pool result equal to great vacations.i recommend this nice hotel to anybody  that would like to enjoy a place witth all this enjoyment to spend witn family

We had the occasion to spend a night there last weekend.  Sadly, we picked one of the accessible rooms due to my wife's severe RA.  It was a huge mistake.  Room 108 contains the worst bed either of us has ever slept on.  Bar none.  My wife was ready to leave at 1am.  We made it until 5am then we started packing.  Other than that it was OK if you enjoy a view of the back parking lot and the sound of the gate going to it slamming shut all the time.  The room itself was dreary, somewhat stained and reminiscent of a creepy 1970s Motel 6 room.  Updated decor, a paint job and new bed would be a dramatic improvement but you would still have that scintillating parking lot view.  I did the Best Western customer service form and received an email from the manager stating if there was

We booked two nights here via hotwire, and we were very happy with our stay.  There was plenty of parking, and it was easy to find.  The area felt very safe, so I didn't mind the fact that the doors open straight to the outside.  While the motel is fairly close to the ocean, we decided to drive to the beach since we have young kids.  The San Clemente pier was a quick, easy drive.   The rooms had a decent amount of space. My wife made use of the laundry room here since we were staying around LA for two weeks.  There is a wide variety of food nearby, everything from fast food to upscale dining.   Our only complaint was that the free breakfast was probably the worst free breakfast I've ever seen in a hotel.  The breakfast room is tiny and you have to ask someone to hand you the

Summary Heading: Best Western Casablanca is a great destination
Summary: I have been booking at this Best Western for twenty years now, and really enjoy the experience.  I have started staying in the rooms with a private balcony, and that has made my stay even more enjoyable.

we stayed two nights because we had van trouble, the staff was very helpful in finding a place to have it fixed. and this motel was very clean and very reasonable for the area. only three blocks from the ocean and in a very nice neighborhood.

We stayed two nights in San Clemente and booked this hotel through hotwire.  The price was reasonable considering that you always pay more for accommodations along the pacific coast highway.  The hotel is nothing fancy but does the job.  Rooms are big and clean though not the quietest.  It's located away from the business part of the town so you will be driving a short distance if you want choice restaurants, shopping and such.  But the plus side is that it is quiet in the evening and has easy access to the beach.  Ample of onsite parking, easy access to rooms from parking lot.  All in all, a decent hotel for the price we paid.

Nice, clean hotel near the beach, but no view.  Great location, close to a great coffee shop, (Kaylani Coffee) and about 10 minutes from Downtown San Clemente.  Rooms are large and comfortable. Breakfast consists of coffee, yogurt, fruite, great to manage your appetite until you find one of the great breakfast places in town. Near Ave Pico, and just 5 minutes from the freeway.

we spent two nights in san clemente on our way to palm springs and twentynine palms marine corps base .  hotel is on north side of town [ 1 mile ] from towncenter.  good location because of traffic in center of town .  hotel was nice , quite and a fair buffett bkfst.,  if in san clemente DO NOT miss  the   LA GALETTE CRAPERIE for there crepes.  it is a very small and odd looking place BUT  the food is outstanding . we have had crepes from paris to nice france and these are better .

I arrived very late and needed some sleep. Unfortunately, the way how the building is designed and being on the first floor, you ca hear everything going on outside. There were several hotel guest with children having loud conversations around my room at a very early hour. I mean it sounded as if they were in my room. Nearby, I could hear a large-sized dog barking in the room. Then, one of the service workers was shouting to another person right outside my room. Again, it was very early in the morning. Don't they realize people are still resting! The room was clean but definitely old, dark and gloomy. It also had a strange smell, maybe because it was a room for pets. The carpet was stained and needed to be replaced. The breakfast was OK although it was packaged. The only plus

Summary Heading: Excellent Service, Just be sure you get the right room
Summary: The service was excellent. We arrived early, and the warm woman at the desk checked to see if our room was ready and let us check in early. More importantly, the room was sparkling clean.   We didn't pay attention when reserving our room and got an "Accessible Room" for the disabled. This would have been fine except that our room is next to the door to the breakfast area and the door that many use when entering and exiting. The door is loud when it closes, so we had trouble sleeping and were woken early by it. Unfortunately, there were no other rooms available.  The breakfast is okay; it's standard.

We recently stayed at the Best Western Plus Casablanca Inn. The room was larger than most, and each room had a nice balcony overlooking the courtyard. The location was great, and the staff was helpful. We will definitely stay here again.

Liked it so much we came back for a 2nd stay and brought family. Attentive staff. Really nice property and great location with short walk to beach. Decent breakfast. Best hot tub and pool. Fun shopping area. Easy access.

Excellent value for this location (a merely nice and convenient location at the edge of the very nice town of San Clemente).  The facility is a somewhat old, but very clean and well-maintained, and our 2Q room was much larger than we expected for the price, and very nice overall.  The breakfast was 'just" a continental breakfast (including toast/bagels but no other hot food), but that was as advertised, so no complaints.

Summary Heading: Should be better, could be worse!
Summary: Because they took dogs for ONLY $20.00 extra, I selected this hotel.  Average and reasonable in cost, the room was dark, dank, and noisy.  Biggest problem that was never fixed was the card lock failure for 6 times.  Very annoying and not sure why the staff did not look into the issue.  The breakfast was "plastic"...meaning everything was wrapped in it!  Except the coffee!  Parking can be a challenge too, but the location was excellent for getting around the area.

clean, well located. Jacuzzi tub at no additional charge was nice! Staff was friendly and efficient. The complimentary breakfast left a little to be desired, as it was breakfast muffins and kids cereal boxes.

We had to stay in San Clemente for family matters. The experience at the Best Western Casablana Inn made to experience easier to deal with. The room was very nice, the beds were comfortable and the continental breakfast was set up nicely and was fresh and good

This place has all you need for a convenient stay in San Clemente.  We have stayed several times.  It is always clean and quiet.  They have a good breakfast with lots of options.  The pool is fine.  The parking is ample.

I stay here every time I come to San Clemente. The staff is some of the best I have ever encountered. They go out of their way to help.The rooms are great, big and always clean. You know what to expect every time you arrive. The price is very reasonable for a beach town. The hotel is close to everything you might need.

I stayed here for one night on my way back from San Diego. The hotel is in a good location. Room was very clean and comfortable. We also used the swimming pool. It is very close to the beach. I like San Clemente beach. Nice view and not too crowded. My sun was so excited when he saw Amtrak train passed by the beach.  The breakfast is of good quality. Just that the choices is a bit limited.

Hotel was ok, but the advertised breakfast existed only as a cellophaned bagel. We ended having to go out and found a nice restaurant, but it added $45. to the cost that we had paid for the 2 rooms that we had.

Our over night stay at the Casablanca was quite nice.Friendly staff. Very nice breakfast, room and pool. Enjoyed our San Clemente lunches at Italian Cravings Cafe and The Riders Club Cafe. The hotel was almost at capacity the night we were there. they could use more space for breakfast.

After almost three weeks in the US - two of which were riding a Harley from Orlando to LA, San Clemente was our second last stop and we are so pleased we came.  It was never on our original plan, but after leaving San Diego we decided to have one last night stopover before hitting LA and this is where we landed.  Firstly let me say what a lovely spot San Clemente is - just beautiful.  We found the Casablanca Inn online and it was super reasonably priced, so we expected something pleasant but nothing extraordinary.  How surprised we were then when we arrived to a lovely large spacious room, with a hot tub and small kitchenette.  It was clean and appeared very new (or perhaps recently refurbed) ... the bed was huge and wonderfully comfortable.  I got chatting to one of the staff

We enjoyed a very pleasant week in San Clemente at the BW Casablanca. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are well kept, the beds are most comfortable. It's a relatively quiet point on the El Camino Real and one can truly relax here.

I wasn't expecting too much. Hotel near the beach - should be pricy and run down. Was I ever surprised. Pleasant staff, extremely clean, heated pool and jacuzzi, continental breakfast, clean rooms with microwave and refrigerator. The A/C unit - quitest I have ever heard. Very comfortable stay!

Hotel is very attractive with Spanish influence,  Very clean.  It is located in San Clemente, CA  a few blocks from the sea, but within walking distance to the sea and small restaurants.  Very easy to find off the freeway.

We needed a good hotel for an overnight due to a 2-day family event in the San Clemente area.  We usually stay at the Las Brisas Best Western in Palm Springs, CA and thought this would work fine for our purposes.  The room was clean and comfortable; staff was friendly and helpful and the comp continental breakfast served the next morning was good.  Location is close driving proximity to Dana Point where we needed to be on second day.  Location is close to ocean and PCH as well as freeway close.

The staff was friendly and accomodating.  However the facilities were going through some rnovations so the lobby area was some what disorganized.  The breakfast was not on a par with other BW Plus's that I have stayed.

After a very helpful check in led to a lovely day at the beach, I can honestly say my husband and I were pleasantly surprised!  We enjoyed sipping our coffee in the garden and the spa tub was wonderful.  Our king bed was a plus, and we loved the proximity to the beach and small town.  I enjoyed the state beach thoroughly, and our number one reason for going there was some helpful advice from a front desk clerk!

Summary Heading: Fantastic Place to Stay in San Clemente
Summary: We had a wonderful stay at this great hotel!  Great service and super clean and nice room with a mountain view.  Few block from the beach and San Clemente beach trail.. The staff was extremely helpful with a forgotten iPhone cable and at breakfast.  We are planning to stay here every time we return to San Clemente!

Summary Heading: One-night stop at the end of our OC road trip
Summary: Stayed for one-night at the end of an OC road trip, before heading onto San Diego. It was a good location for that stop, easy to find.  Parking free and we had no problem finding a space.  There was a renovation going on to some of the public spaces (like the front desk/check-in) when we were there so I expect they are doing some upgrades.  Didn't spend much time there - in rather late, out rather early - but sleep well, beds were comfortable, everything was clean, internet, shower, and TV worked.  Met our expectations!  Room was large and was nice to have a balcony overlooking a quaint little courtyard area (though we didn't spend any time on the balcony, or in the courtyard!). The breakfast was not the most elaborate Best Western breakfast we've had ... mostly minor

We stay here when we visit son and family twice or more each year. It is a clean,quiet and has very customer friendly staff. Nice location to beach and restaurants.  We really enjoy the convenience of the location. There is always something going on in city like great Farmer's Market downtown on Sunday afternoons.

Great place, but lousy breakfast. No meat or eggs . I think they could improve this hotel with a decent breakfast. This is the first hotel in the Best Western chain that I have visited that didn't have any eggs or meat.  I had to go elsewhere to get brekfast

My stay at this hotel was terrible. The front desk people are very rued & not accommodating at all. The rooms are half way decent, overall I will not be staying here again. They do not make you feel welcomed.

This BW is in a good location and practical for a nice weekend or overnight getaway. Within walking distance from beach, train rentals. Several casual restaurant within walking distance or or short 5 min drive.

One block walk to North beach.  Friendly and considerate staff.   Not too far  (driving) from pier, restaurants, and shops in old downtown San Clemente.  We've been here several times before and will return again.

Overall, we would stay here again.  We were just put in a room that had many things that needed to be fixed and since we were only there for a maximum of 2 nights, we did not report our findings until we checked out.  The location of the hotel was perfect since we were looking for a hotel in between Bellflower and San Diego, CA where two of sons live.  We did not use any of the amenities offered with the exception of the continental breakfast, which would have been nice to have a hot breakfast but any breakfast is better than none.

Summary Heading: Clean, good location, friendly staff and large room
Summary: We stumbled upon this inn and booked a room with kingsize bed on the lower floor. This hotel is within a 4min walk of the north beach of San clemente. The room was quite large and well eguipped with fridge, big tv screen (we did not use it though) and bubble bath. The pool area is well maintained, the hotel offers free parking. Staff is very friendly and accomodating. The included breakfast is meager to European standards, with all pre-packed bagels and stuff, but this is probably typical American as we never had decent breakfast in any hotel we booked. Tip: walk from north beach to the pier on the coastal trail and have a sunset cocktail at fishermans

The Casablanca Inn has moved up considerably on our list of preferred hotels since first time we stayed there about 6 or 7 years ago.  I want to especially point out the very considerate attention and service I received on several occasions during my stay, from Katerina in Guest Services.  She made a stressful time just a bit easier to deal with, simply by making just a bit more effort than necessary.  Many could take a lesson from her!  I will say I had never experienced the breakfast room practice of getting bakery items (bagels, muffins, toast, packaged pancakes) from the kitchen worker and waiting for her to toast/microwave them.  It was a little awkward and seriously unnecessary in my opinion.  I could understand if she was there to operate one of those waffle bakers so

Best Western has really improved their image.  We will be staying at Best Western more frequently .  the rooms were clean and impressive  the locations were in safe area. The staff in the three locations were friendly and helpful.

My sons and I went to visit my sister who lives in San Clemente for Xmas.  We have stayed here before.  It is a very clean, safe and reasonably priced hotel. The location is very good.  It is about 3/4 of a mile from the beach and pier. Easy to walk to in the warm California sunshine!  The beds and pillows are wonderful.  There are down comforters on the beds. There is no restaurant in the hotel, however there is a quality continental breakfast offered each morning.  This hotel has a hot tub and pool as well!

The hotel we stayed at was better than some of the four or five star hotels I've stayed in.  I found the room to be extremely large and comfortable.  The lay out was great and everything was set up for convenience.  We were just taking a one night get away.  However I would suggest this hotel highly to anyone traveling to the San Clemente area.

We found this BW to be great.  It is mid-range place to stay, and comfortable and roomy.  We had two queen beds, both comfortable and with plenty of space around the room.
