There were two suitcase holders, which worked perfectly for us.  The little desk was just right.  The breakfast was very nice.  There was a server who gave us items behind the counter and he made sure everything was well stocked.  Gracious and kind.  The front desk staff were also great--efficient and friendly. They sold post cards from a local artist which made for such a nice memento.  The beach is about a two-minute walk from the hotel that leads to a great beach walking path back to the pier.  Great location and great experience.

Comfortable Beds, Large room, Good Location, Good Customer Service, Lots of restaurants in the area, this is definitely a place I would stay again and refer other people to stay.  The staff was friendly and accomodating.  The beds were very comfortable - not rock hard or extra firm.

This is my first time staying in San Clemente, CA. I usually stay at Dana Point Harbor, or San Juan Capistrano. The Casablanca Inn is a very comfortable, safe place to stay for a person traveling alone. The hotel staff was very courteous, and cheerful.  The entire staff, from the front desk personnel to the housekeeping personnel were all very professional and attentive to my needs. The hotel is an older facility but, well maintained and clean, inside and out. The ocean and San Clemente Pier are approximately one half block from the hotel so no need to drive to the beach. Great, relaxing stay.

I choose this hotel because of price and loyalty. I am a BW rewards member. It was my first stay in San Clemente. I found this hotel to be the normal for BW Plus. The staff were friendly and professional. The room was clean and was in working order. The beach was in walking distance as well as local business's in San Clemente. The hotel was what I would expect of BW Plus. I would stay at this property again

Summary Heading: Pet friendly and near the beach but bad odor
Summary: Went here for 3 nights with my husband and 2 of our dogs.  I chose this hotel because they were pet friendly(and didn't gouge you with pet deposits, only $20 per night) and near the beach.  They have designated pet rooms on the first floor.  My husband checked in prior and upon entering the room I was hit with a very bad mildew odor which did not mellow over time.  Also the carpet felt wet or greasy not sure which.  Parking area is tight but extra parking nearby.  They have a free breakfast but I usually just have coffee.  The other issue I had is the bathroom sink is actually in the room no door to separate, so when I had to get up early and leave to go to work my husband was awoken.  Not the best design.  Rooms are okay seemed a bit over priced.

A beautiful motel, far enough from the freeway and close enough to the beach to be perfect.  Great spa and salt water pool.  Two good restaurants nearby and two coffee shop/bakeries.  Walking distance to train station. The people who work at the hotel have been there for years and treat it like it is their own home. Many different great rooms and you can have pets in a few. Everything is immacuate. I hate to tell others about this place because I want it all for myself!

This is an old motel, but very clean.  We stayed here one night.  It's within walking distance to a rocky beach, but not much else.  Parking is limited.  Our room had a balcony, which was a nice place to sit and watch people coming and going. The staff gave excellent advice on where to eat.  If you are on a budget definitely stay here.

Summary Heading: Very, very average for the price.
Summary: Close to the beach, nice to have kitchen facilities but overall the accommodations were very average and the room was extremely small.  Breakfast although free, was not anything special.   The coffee was okay.

perfect / nice location, near to the beach train station and trail approx 5 min, the hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly, free breakfast was very good, no train noise! free parking, we will stay at hotel again

The hotel was OK.  The housekeeping staff was very nice and helpful.  PARKING IS A PROBLEM.  SMALL, TIGHT SPACES AND NOT ENOUGH FOR THE NUMBER OF ROOMS!  Do NOT stay on the first floor unless you have a pet and like very strong pet odors.

Our room was clean and quiet. The hotel has a lovely fountain area in the courtyard with tables for  visiting and a huge pool also. The location is within walking distance from the beach, great restaurants and shopping is near too. Great value for such a nice hotel.

As I have previously read from other visitors, the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. We had a nice balcony and the pool was great. The breakfast was minimul. The coffee and bagel was enjoyable. I would recommend this hotel. The staff was very nice. I would like to compliment the Manager, Mr. Moser for being so accommodating since I messed-up on the date I should have been there, my fault. Its a nice walk to the beach. Overall, a very nice stay. I would stay here again.

Stayed for a wedding, multiple rooms for family. Ants in two of the rooms. Smells. Rooms not ready when promised. Have stayed at Best Western many times before. Never ran into this. Did not expect to find ants on the third floor!!  Staff knew of the block of rooms reserved for a wedding, but did not have them ready.

Overall it was a nice hotel for the money. Our A/C broke on the first night and we went to the front desk at 4am but there were no other rooms available to move us to so we had to wait until the next day for a new room. They did upgrade our room for the inconvenience which was nice. The new room was nice but the water pressure was terrible!

Despite being on the main drag, the hotel was quiet & restful, staff efficient & helpful. Pool area clean, rooms comfortable.  Easy walk to beach trail to pier (1 mile).  Breakfast choices were many & good.  Breakfast male staff was excellent in customer service.  Rate was reasonable.

This location is a quaint property tucked away in the beach town of San Clemente, CA. It's a short walk to the beautiful coast line where you can walk along the beach or go out on the pier, go swimming or surfing, grab a bite to eat at the beach side snack bar or the restaurant at the end of the pier. The rooms are well appointed and clean with nice areas to sit outside or at the pool. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Recently stayed here on business and found this great hotel really close to North Beach. A typical beach town hotel in so many ways.  Not the greatest room, television or amenities for a business traveler (i.e. half the electrical outlets didn't work, the a/c barely worked, etc.).  The breakfast room was all jacked up (I hate asking permission to have a bagel).  All things considered, I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. The convenient access to the beach washes away the various inconveniences of the hotel. The location is what it's all about.

Stayed here for two nights with my husband.  The room was large and clean with a small refrigerator and microwave.  Even the in room coffee was good.  Minimal breakfast buffet but the service was very good.  Good fitness center and nice pool.  Not far from the beach and pier.  Overall a great place to stay.  Very comfortable bed.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your kind review.  We are pleased you enjoyed your stay with us.  We have been working hard to upgrade our property to ensure our customers have a pleasant experience with us.  We hope to see you again in the future, hopefully we will be finished with our breafast room remodel.  Beginning in January 2014 we will be working hard to offer our customers a better breakfast offering. Eric Moser GM

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel! Stayed a week here
Summary: Within walking distance to the beach (a few blocks). Not very big fans of staying at hotels. I do have to say that this hotel was different than most. Isn't the newest, but kept up very nice. Very clean, and comfortable! Hotel staff was always on the move, helping cust's, cleaning, maintaining, etc., always very pleasant. Rooms always made up promptly, and kept very clean. Very impressed that the only bug seen, was a dead one in one of the outdoor stairwells (swept up by the time we walked by again). Continental breakfast was what one would expect, There's an employee, in the breakfast area, who hands out plates, and the prepackaged food. Not saying this is a bad thing, just that the tip jar sitting on the counter does kind of come across as begging. I would suggest that you let
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for reviewing our property.  We are pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us.  I will take into consideration the point you brought up about the tip jar in the breakfast area.  Believe it or not it was the owners idea to have one there, he visits the property often and always goes into the breakfast room for a coffee and muffin, and to meet with the guests.  He likes to tip our breakfast attendant because the breakfast room is always so nice and clean and well stocked with our breakfast offerings.  When we renovate the breakfast room we will be ensuring the breakfast is 100% self service. Eric Moser GM

Summary: Hotel was great and the few employees we did run into were friendly.  Called in the morning to request a late check out and was told that they had already exceeded late check outs and that we would have to leave or be charged for another night.  Told them i would try to be out of there by noon.  Got a call at 12:05pm askign if i was paying for another night.  Received a knock on the door at 12:15 pm.  Didnt appreciate any of that since i had stayed at the hotel.
Manager Response: Dear guest, Thank you for the nice review of our property.  I apologize we were unable to extend a late check out during your stay.  Since we are right by the beach, we do recieve many requests for late check outs on the weekends.  We try our best to honor all late check out requests.  I recommend asking for a late check out during the reservation process as those requests are always accomodated first.   If you decide to return to our property again in the future please ask for me and I would be happy to make your reservation for you and ensure and extended late check out. Eric Moser GM

Summary: My family and I have stayed here over the past few years, as this is only blocks away from San Clemente State Beach, the Metrolink/Amtrak Train Station, and the San Clemente Pier.  The room as clean, internet worked great, and the complimentary breakfast was good like usual.  The pool was in great shape, as it is a salt water pool.  It was good for my skin.  I would recommend this place.  Parking however, expecially at night can be hard to find on the main parking area, but there is a back parking lot with lighting and an secure gated entrance into the hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for the great review of our property.  I think our location is ideal as well.  Many of our customers take the metrolink train, as we are located just 2 blocks from the train station.  The pier is walking distance from the hotel down the beautiful beach trail San Clemente put in a few years ago.  I do have to let you know however that we currently do not use a salt water filtration system in our pool.  Although it has been considered, we still have not made that change.  Our pool service company is however the best we have used at our hotel.  They maintain the chemicals perfectly to ensure an enjoyable experience when swimming in our pool. Eric Moser GM

Summary: This was a good hotel to stay at primarily the pool and beach access are the main value, you can walk to the main drag Del Mar and you have beach access so you don't have to pay for parking at the beach.  If your going to stay here suggest booking early to get the best prices.  I saw prices range from $94 (people checking in next to us) to $177 dollars for people checking in on the weekend with no prior reservations.  If you are a non smoker be adamant about being kept away from the ashtrays on decks of the hotels and people that smoke (only bad experience I had there).
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for the nice review of our property.  It is wise advice that you gave about booking early.  Our rates fluctuate based on demand, and as we become more filled up our rates increase, sometimes by over 50%.  We also removed the ash trays from the hotel walkways and found that guests still smoked, but put their cigarette butts out on the floors or flicked them out into the courtyard so we put ashtrays back to help prevent littering.   Eric Moser GM

Summary Heading: Clean, Good Location, and Good Value!
Summary: We stayed at the Casablanca Inn for two nights commencing on Sunday, August 18, 2013.  The room was very clean, and well stocked with towels.  The location is great; you can walk to a great burger place (Riders Club) and the beach is only 2 blocks away.  We enjoyed the beaches of San Clemente, but due to erosion, much of the closest beach is nothing but gravel.  The beaches of Laguna Beach are very close as well, and only a short drive away.  Pros: 1.  Good location - close to beach, beach trails, and restaurants. 2.  Good value relative to other properties in the area 3.  Excellent service from employees that  go out of their way to make sure you're happy  Cons: 1. It was a bit humid in the room, but we fixed this problem by simply opening the window.  Overall, the Best Western

This was a great experience. The room was spacious, clean and quiet. Hotel close to area attractions. Breakfast room had a staff to assist you. Easy check in and out. We will stay here again. Pool area clean and patio area with fountain was nice to sit and have coffee and watch the hummingbirds dance around the flowers. We have stayed at another best western in the area but we would come back and stay here in San Clemente. They have elevator and bell cart to use for your luggage. Parking is limited but we were able to find a spot each day.

Great place to stay for the price. We stayed in a pet room, which was very clean with the exception of a few minor things... the bed was comfortable, breakfast was good and the overall grounds were nicely groomed. We will definitely be returning!

We rarely get away from home and this was all done at the last minute because we were attending a family wedding on Catalina.  After getting up at 3:00 a.m. to get to the boat dock and not getting back to the mainland until 8:15 p.m., it was a relief not to face the 2 1/2 hour drive home.  The room and amenities were very clean and nice and the staff was wonderful.  Great place to stay!!

It literallly took us 4 minutes to walk to the beach from out hotel.  The room was big and clean.  The breakfast was O.K. I live in San Diego so I know how busy beach communities can be. However, this area was very laid back and low key. Decent price.

Our room was 2nd floor directly across the courtyard from the office. That didn't do us any good when it came to getting some sleep. Prior to 11pm I'm OK w/ people talking, laughing etc. outside for short period of time while going to their rooms but come on! 11:30 pm a group was talking very loudly, laughing and yelling to others right outside the office. I called to complain and she said she'd take care of it. 15 minutes later they're still out there drinking or whatever and I called again asking if she was going to stop it or did I need to call the police. It stopped. 1:15 am I'm woken up by drunks hanging out in the courtyard making all kinds of noise. I called the office and she told me..."but they are just checking in". AS if that makes it all OK! A hotel that has staff so

My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for our surf trip. It was nice and clean and after a long surf session, this hotel room was roomy and comfortable and clean! We felt like no one else was there. We had a balcony for the wetsuits to dry out and the bed was so comfortable.We'll stay there again!

overall a good experience and pricing (Wedding group price). Plenty of parking from and back of hotel and great location (Walking distance to the beach). For the price, quality and location, I was satisfied.
Manager Response: Hi Tyler, Thank you for taking the time to review our property.  We are fortunate to be so close to the Casino San Clemente where the wedding took place.  I am glad you had a great time, and appreciate the nice things you said about your stay.

Summary: Great Rooms with Balconies. Nice to have complimentary breakfast and free parking. Didn't care for the location of the pool but nice to have outdoor pool. Nice seating areas outside. Close and convenient to airport.
Manager Response: Hi Leta, I do know what you mean about the location of the pool being behind the guest rooms instead of in the center of the property.  The pool location was chosen because it was the location that has the best sunlight on the property.  Althought the location is behind the hotel I hope you enjoyed the vast array of tropical plants that surround the area.  Thank you for reviewing our property and the nice things you had to stay.

Summary: Nice hotel in a good location, nice friendly staff and close to all the area has to offer. Would use the hotel again if in the area and as always Best Western provided a good service with friendly staff and nice rooms

This hotel is in a great location, within walking distance to the beach and some nice restaurants as well. The staff is by far the best at any hotel I have stayed at. They are friendly, helpful and make the stay very pleasant. The grounds are nice and clean with pretty flowers and plants to give it a nice relaxing, tropical atmosphere. There are plenty of room choices, some with ocean views and jacuzzi tubs, some with a balcony. I have always gotten nice rooms here. They are clean and nicely decorated. I definitely plan on coming back and would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice beach getaway.

Would suggest this hotel and staff to any one visiting the area.  Well worth it and lots of good food near by, beaches and lots more to see.     They are always glad to see us and our 2 4 legged children when we get there.   If you like strawberries, there is a nice farm stand in Dana Point that has really great ones along with cherries and other good fruit at nice prices.   We like this Best Western the most of all the ones in the area.

run down needed of facelift great complementary breakfast but rooms very humid and smelly outside not apealing. pool was okmsize not busy at all tight parking spaces the closest beach very rocky dirty would never stay there again.
Manager Response: I apologize about the inconveniences during your stay.  I know some significant erosion is occuring at the beach located near the hotel.  The city is planning on relocating sand from the surrounding beaches in order to replenish our beach, hopefully this process will begin in 2014 and continue for about 1 year, and our beaches will be back to normal.  I am glad you enjoyed the pool & the breakfast.  We are currently completing our remodel and should be finished by early 2014.  I hope you will consider staying with us again.  We appreciate you taking the time to review our property.

Summary: This hotel was very nice and clean.  It had a tropical feeling to it.  The service was very good, room clean and the accommodations very nice.  The pool and hot tub was great and the people working there were very helpful.  I would return there again.

My Wife and I stayed at the Hotel for a Weekend and pleasantly were surprised on how nice it was was, no complaints for us, a nice roomy room and nice breakfast and nice pool and close to Ocean what more good you ask for.

The hotel was close to the beach, beautiful scenic footpath that leads to the peir,  the train station, (next trip I'm taking my bike on the train and riding to the hotel from the train), a sushi place across the street!

Everything was great!  I read a lot of reviews of San Clemente hotels/inns, and chose this location because of Tripadvisor reviews.  The location was exactly what we wanted, just 2 short blocks from the sand, and walking distance (approx a mile) to downtown.  There's a very nice beach trail that takes you to the pier (about 30 min) which we walked.  The room seemed to be recently remodeled, and quiet.  Swimming pool was really warm, which I appreciated.  I was lucky enough to have it to myself, in the evening.  I would recommend this hotel whole heartedly!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and share you experiences with others.  I think we do have the best location in San Clemente for the value.  The beach trail is relatively new, built about 3 years ago now, and is a great addition to our city.  I am glad you enjoyed your stay, and we look forward to the next time your plans bring you to our City.

Summary: This is the second time we've stayed here, and we will go back again.  Very clean and comfortable room.  Included breakfast is wonderful, and lots to choose from to eat.  Staff very helpful and friendly.

Summary Heading: Fine for guests on a budget
Summary: We stayed here because we were attending a wedding in San Clemente/Laguna Beach. We chose this hotel because we were on a budget and also because it was pet friendly. The hotel was  fine for what we needed. Definitely not luxury by any means, but it works. The bed was pretty big and comfy from what I remember, bathroom was spacious . They put us in a room right next to the laundry room on the first floor, which I wasn't too happy about because as you can imagine it was busy every day with the maids changing sheets etc. BUT that wasn't a deal breaker. What annoyed us most was the loud, drunk guests that were staying there for another wedding. They were wandering around the hotel grounds with open containers and yelling at all hours. They were told multiple times to be quiet but
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Unfortunately there are those times when noisy guests can ruin the stay of others. We do try hard to maintain a quiet atmosphere at the hotel and are trying to impliment new strategies to keep those guests quieter.  We  hope you return and use your voucher for a free night.  I recommend staying in one of our Deluxe rooms, these rooms are larger, have a large jetted tub, and have upgraded furnishings for your comfort.

Summary: I recently checked into the Casablanca Inn to attend a wedding in San Clemente. Soon after my arrival to California, my wallet was stolen and inside of it was my id, money, and credit cards. I was able to get a ride to the hotel and when I arrived I learned I would have to drive 35 mins back to the town where my wallet was stolen in order to file a police report to be able to board my flight later that weekend. Desperate and upset, the friendly General Manager at the Casablanca Inn recognized that I was in a jam and offered to drive me to and from the police station in order to file my claim. The general manager went above and beyond what he needed to do to make my stay in California pleasant and I wouldn't have been able to fully enjoy my trip without his help. In addition to

Summary Heading: Perfect, except the shower didnt work.
Summary: Hotel staff was super friendly, gave me a free vase for my flowers, even got a free upgrade when our original room wasn't ready. Rooms are super classy and comfortable (way better than those for the same price.)  However, my shower did not work! I had to bath in a cold trickle from the shower head. :(
Manager Response: Dear guest, We apologize about the inconvenience with the shower.  Those tubs can be tricky to operate, I do not think the company we contracted to install the shower controls realized how difficult they can be to operate. We did check to ensure the shower was operational, and what we found was the control valve that switches the water from the tub to the shower was in a neutral position and stopping all water from coming out.   We are happy to hear you enjoyed the rest of your visit, and hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Check in 03/28/13 - Check out 03/29/13.  Only a one night stay due to a family emergency, but was pleasantly surprised as I walked in the room.  Clean and smelled good.  I was in room 101, so a little noisy but it wasn't terrible and not much they can do about it (right next to the highway).  Couldn't hear any neighbors so the walls must be nice and thick - most noise comes from the front door.  Super close to the beach if that's your thing.   Bed = comfortable Shower = nice and hot Room = clean and modern Staff at front desk = nice  Will stay again with my wife if we are down this way on an actual vacation.

This was a nice hotel with a good price. Actually made reservations on the day we arrived, best rate was on Best Western website. Room was nice and a good size, breakfast had lots of options. Short walk to the beach. We didn't not take advantage but this hotel is kid and pet friendly.

My family and I headed out to San Clemente for a weekend getaway.  I booked our hotel through Hotels.com, site unseen. I was pleasantly suprised when we arrived. The hotel is located less than 2 short blocks away from the beach. The hotel staff is very friendly. The room was clean and spacious and they provide you with a light continental breakfast. The pool area is clean and private. It was nice to be able to swim in a hotel pool and not feel like you are swimming in the middle of a parking lot.  This hotel is an older hotel compared to some of the higher priced hotels in the area but it is definately not rundown. My family and I will be back this summer.

Summary Heading: Comfortable, free wifif and parking, good breakfast
Summary: This hotel was a surprise find. Off street parking, free wifi, very confortable beds, reasonable priced and a good breakfast included in the tarrif. Easy walk to the beach and a little uphill walk into the township of San Clemente. Staff polite and knowledgable.

Whilst waiting to check in two customers were extending their stay - always a good sign... We were not disappointed - we had a room with a balcony which was well decorated and very clean, breakfast was to the usual Best Western standard - staff were helpful and courteous, wifi worked well. The motel was well located for the beach (only a few hundred yards away) and about a mile from. San Clemente centre. Very good value all round. We also extended our stay :-)

For the most part, it was as good as always, with a lot of rehab going on.  We were a little surprised at the low temp of the hot water in the shower and the fact that the tv remote was lacking function capabilities, but nothing drastic.  The most upstting thing was the fact that the hotel is posted 100 percent non smoking and yet there are people smoking right outside all the non smoking patio rooms and large ashtray recepticles placed close to door ways also.  State law in Ca. says no smoking within 25-50 ft of any door way.

Very Nice Desk staff, Quiet room(got deluxe queen.), Room had a nice little kitchenette in it, Very clean, great bathroom, decent breakfast, good price. Definitely a nice place for the price. The bed was very comfortable and so were the pillows! Will stay here again!

Summary Heading: No water - it didn't bother the staff.
Summary: We walked into our room and were surprised at how out of date and grubby it was.  Upon inspecting the bathroom found a bobby pin laying in the middle of the floor.  Hard to miss that if you are cleaning.  It was late so decided to keep the room anyway - yuck.  Got up in the morning, NO WATER.  NONE.  Called the front desk.  Got some run around.  About a half hour later called again - a little more run around.  Called again and they offered to send us to another room 3 floors and a bit of a walk away to shower.  REALLY????  Why didn't they do that in the first place?  Why didn't they offer us some sort of compensation?  My husband did go and take a shower in the other room and found it to be much upgraded from the one they had given us.  Why if that room was empty the night
Manager Response: Dear Guest.  We do apologize for the unfortunate circumstance that occurred during your stay.  About 6:30a.m. A company we hired to perform a test on our backflow system came to our property and during their test they broke a valve that  thoughout the morning began to turn our water off to the building in which you were staying.  The company never bothered to inform the hotel regarding the issue, and it was up to us to find and resolve the problem.  Our only recourse was to open rooms in another building to allow our guests to use the showers until we could fix the problem.  Our plumbers arrived and resolved the issue within a few hours.  I would be glad to offer you a discount off a future stay.  Please call the hotel direct and ask for me.  Eric M

Summary Heading: Awesome stay but too much to hear
Summary: We were given a room in the "new wing" of the hotel.  The interior was very nice with lots of accommodations but we could hear the couple next door talking and making love ALL night long.  It was terribly unfortunate in such a nice room with a wonderful bed.   The walls need to be insulated.

My Husband, me, and our two dogs stayed at the Casablanca Jan. 31, 2012 and we were incredibly satified. Eric, at the front desk, took our reservation over the phone and gave us a great deal on a room that also allowed our pets. The pet fee is lower here than other places, as it is a flat rate for all pets. The room was updated, clean and spacious. The location is unbeatable as it is a short walk to the beach and the walking path that leads to downtown. After we left, I realized I had left a precious ring. I thought I would never see it again. However, Eric called me to let me know that housekeeping had turned it in. He sent it to my home the same day we spoke. I was floored by the integrity of the staff. Thank you!

Summary Heading: Older but worthy hotel on El Camino Real
Summary: I've stayed here in the late 1990s and early 2000s with my late wife when our son lived in a studio apartment six blocks away over-looking the ocean in this classic Orange County beach town. The Casablaca is now a Best Western. the rooms are large, some with generous balconies. New one-piece shower-tubs have been installed with a bowed chrome shower curtain rod for generous space.  A large granite counter with full mirror above and a single sink set off to the right allows for ladies to spread out the contents of their make-up bag.  My king size bed was comfortable and warmer than the room on this cold-by-OC-standards Christmas weekend.  Upon checking out I was told the thermostat was by the patio door, not the entrance.  My $98. Winter room rate included an in-room 4-cup coffee

Summary Heading: One of the better Best Western locations
Summary: Always thought of Best Western hotels as run down but the Casablanca Inn is a nice one (for a cheap room). Didn't interact with the staff too much after check-in but they were friendly if looking a little bored 100% of the time.  The room was clean if a little sparse but what can you expect for what you're paying. Beds were comfy and extra linen was provided if you needed it. There was free wi-fi if you wanted it and I had no problems using it.

This motel is a bit older but very well maintained....very clean.  Pool and hot tub, good continental breakfast.  No really close restaurants but good choices within 2-3 miles.  Easy to find and very close to beach.  Bed (queen size) was good, room had a nice patio.  Guests in room above ran tub over which resulted in water leak in our bathroom.  Staff resolved it quickly and gave us a discount for that day.  We'd stay there again.

We checked in and headed to our room, but when we got off the elevator the lights weren't working. Some hallways had lights and some didn't, if I had been alone I would have turned around and left right then.  Didn't feel like a .  We got to our room and were very disappointed.  It was very run down, didn't smell good. Didn't lay on the bed, but it looked like a lumpy mattress. Court yard view is a joke, it's not even courtyard! Needless to say, I lost my nights stay, but I was glad I didn't have to stay.

Summary Heading: Several pluses for this Best Western
Summary: My wife and I enjoyed a full week (be sure to get the full week rate!), which allowed us a convenient mid-point between San Diego, the casinos, Laguna Beach, and Yorba Linda (where we spent Thanksgiving). Our 1st (2nd floor) room was nice but only had a view of the staircase. We changed rooms and went from a double queen to a single (2nd floor) king, with a view toward the courtyard. There are deluxe rooms toward the west end of the hotel, which back to the extra parking lot, however if you get too far to the west, you'll hear traffic noise from El Camino Real.  The breakfast was modest and they had a server to toast your frozen waffle, or microwave your sausage and cheese croissant. Pastries, oatmeal, fresh fruit, and cold cereal were also available along with coffee, hot

Our stay at this hotel was pleasant. The bed was comfortable and the room was fairly clean and well maintained. The biggest problem we experienced was the poor sound proofing in the rooms. Through the walls we could hear conversations and my husband told me he even heard our neighbor snoring. That was a bit of an annoyance to say the least. The breakfast was also disappointing but at least they offered it. The best part of our stay there was the proximity to the beach. Only a few blocks away is a lovely little beach with direct walking access to the San Clemente pier.

Summary Heading: clean property and friendly and helpful staff
Summary: Our destination was legoland and the San Diego zoo,and we happened upon the Casa Blanca.The price of the room for a three night stay checking in on a Saturday night at the end of August was very reasonable(avg.@ $119.00).The rooms were clean and comfortable had the appliances a family of our size needed the fridge,microwave.The beds and linens were very comfortable.plenty of channels for nighttime t.v. watching the free wi fi was a little spotty.The pool/jacuzzi was a hit for myself and the kids.I hit the workout room once and it was little cosy but had all the exercise equipment and weights one could ask for.But the service was the biggest selling point, being in the hospitality business the young lady who checked us in was very kind and friendly and answered all our

Nicest hotel we stayed in on our trip.  A pleasant surprise.  After the disappointment of our hotel in Ridgecrest I called the  Best Western reservations and reserved this hotel.  It is older but has a very nice court yard and is very well maintained.  Nice beds and a good breakfast.  I would definitely stay here again.  WARNING:  I called the phone number that hotwire posts by the hotel trying to get the phone number for the hotel.  The operator claimed to be central reservations for Best Western.  I asked her 3 times if it was Best Western and she claimed it was but it really wasn't.  I beat their best price for this hotel by $30.

This is a great little hotel, great value. The one area that needs reworking is the breakfast. The food is doled out like prescription medication by two staff who even put the bread in the toaster for you. Problem is, the food is high glycemic carbs, no whole grains, no protein. Found out from another guest that boiled eggs and yogurt are available if you ask, but not displayed. This set-up is unlike any breakfast I've ever encountered at a Best Western. Suggestions: Improve the food, have guests serve themselves,

Just returned from 2 weeks in California/Nevada of which 5 nights were spent at the Casablanca.  Haven't a single negative comment to leave.  Check in was quick and friendly, room was large and very comfortable, breakfast was good, plenty of free parking and the pool area was great.  The location is perfect, right on the Pacific Coast Highway just a short walk from the beach and within easy driving distance of some of the best beaches in the world - Laguna Beach, Newport, Huntington etc.  Some really nice restaurants in San Clemente.  Just under an hour gets you to San Diego.

room was large but the lights around the bath/sink were on a timer so would go off every 3-4 min, No hot water at 7am did report was advised the staff would be in at 8-8.30am after my departure did speak the the female front desk supervisor who advised the same was rude and gave a very bad attitude

Summary Heading: Well located, comfortable and good value
Summary: We chose this hotel because it is close to the beach (2 blocks) and not far from local restaurants and the city centre. We stayed two nights.  It was clean and comfortable, with pleasant service at reception. The pool area is large and was particularly appreciated by our 10 year old twin daughters.  Breakfast was included and though simple was just about OK.  Overall, good value.

Summary Heading: Glorydays are gone for this place....
Summary: Staff was nice, it's close to the beach and room was clean. Probably when it opened many yares ago, it was meant as a sort of motor-inn and was very modern in those days. AC is old style and noisy, rooms hace pretty thin walls (....). OK to spend a night a leave again.

Found this hotel on spec on the internet as part of our itinery on our visit to southern california.  A very nice good VFM hotel which offered a basic but adequate breakfast.  Pool area good and central Spanish courtyard feature very nice. Pleasant staff would recommend this hotel.  There is a local beach in walkable distance, and San Clemente village is also walkeable if you are feeling energetic !

This is the second time I have used this hotel and have enjoyed the experience each time.  The pool area is always nice and clean and it is five minutes walk from the beach. At a leisurely walk the pier is only 30 - 40 minutes walk along the seafront away.  The rooms are kept very clean and the staff are always friendly and helpful.

A friend and I stayed three nights in July.  The walk to the beach is much shorter and more scenic than it seems when you first start out along the PCH.  There is a very large (for a motel) pool area with padded chaise lounges and hot tub.  Rooms are quite large and many were recently refurbished although the quality of the work was not up to par in some areas.  Beds were VERY comfortable with good linens.  Internet access (wifi) was somewhat iffy at times; good at others At the time I stayed, I didn't know the difference between a Best Western Plus and Premier.  Now I do.  This hotel is accurately rated a "plus" and is a very good value for those who want beach access nearby, a friendly and helpful front desk staff, and a good night's sleep.

This is a solid mid-range place, on a main street in a quiet neighborhood close to the beach. There is a good amount of parking, clean spacious rooms, two sinks in the generous sized bathroom, clean and well maintained, free wifi. The desk staff were friendly and helpful.   On the downside, I stayed in the new wing, where not as much attention was paid to noise reduction, so I heard my neighbors talk, shower, flush, etc... The breakfast was typical American shrink-wrap - prewrapped everything except some fresh fruit. This part was easily missable except there was no where close to walk for other options.   I would stay again for the price and location.

Summary Heading: Best value for the area, free breakfast, good rooms & location!
Summary: We've stayed at several Best Westerns, and this one was another great deal.  We got a basic King-bed room, and we were happy to have a mini-fridge (free from the stupid buyable items) a small sink/wet-bar and a small table to eat a meal at.  There was also plenty of desk space and a clean/adequate bathroom.  Staff was friendly, and we couldn't find any other hotels in the area offering a free breakfast! The review would have been a full five stars, if we didn't hear so much noise on the floor above us.  The sound isolation was ok though...I think it was just a case of some really stupid guests above us!

Like an aging actress, this may wave been pretty or even lovely in an old fashioned motor inn sort of way, but she is past her prime and probably will not be able to be revived regardless of the effort. Most of the rooms have small trashcans below their loud 50's style air conditioners to catch water drippings, peeling paint, lousy parking, useless wireless, broken ice machines all give the impression of a company trying to kerp up, but falling short. They will provide towels for the pool.. That were just about the size of a hand towel... It was pretty funny... Bring your own if you plan on laying out or swimming. It seems to be regularly sold out, but perhaps Best Western just can't justiey the huge undertaking it would take to upgrade this property to 21st century standards.

The property is old, but intriguing.  It has an outdoor interior courtyard that is charming with a fountain and seating.  My main complaint was the room-granted I did not book early as I was not sure how far I would drive towards SD.  I took a chance and was fortunate to find a room in this hotel.  I paid a premium price for a mediocre room.  I paid extra for a balcony which had a view of a wall.  The balcony might have benefited a smoker, but was ridiculous to me a non-smoker.

Summary Heading: A good stay at a bad time
Summary: A family emergency brought us to San Clemente without time to book any accommodations. Most of the local motels were booked, but we were able to obtain a 3 night stay at this Best Western until the weekend. Unfortunately, our family member passed away on the day we were to leave the motel. We made a call to the front desk and spoke to Tony Gallegos, explaining our dilemma. Within 5 minutes, he called us back, told us we could continue our stay, in the same room, at the weekday price until the following Tuesday. ALL the staff at the front desk were extremely kind and understanding, and upon checkout, Steve made sure that all billing was in order as promised.  The room itself was very comfortable and clean. Parking was good and we were close to restaurants. If we ever come back to
Very nice , love the location very clean , clean rooms good breakfast ...will go back and stay there.

Summary Heading: Great stay near the Marine base
Summary: My dad, brother and I stayed at this hotel when my nephew returned from Afghanistan.  Overall, it was a good, reasonably priced property with a nice pool.  The daily breakfast was also very good.  We were within walking distance to restaurants and the beach, which was nice. The rooms were basic, but nice and clean, and the staff were friendly.  We booked directly through the hotel, which worked out well because our dates did change and the hotel worked with us to change.  If we had to return, I would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Near the beach and freeway, clean and friendly this was a good value.
Summary: Overall a nice property with a nice pool and hot tub, breakfast above average, staff was responsive and helpful.  Able to walk to the beach, mountain biking trails nearby, easy freeway access.  We barbecued by the pool and enjoyed spring break.

We booked the Best Western Casablanca hotel in San Clemente for four nights but left after two nights. It seemed like a lot of young people live at this hotel, and they congregated on the 2nd floor walkway outside our room to smoke and party. (In this part of the hotel, entry to rooms is from outside.) Complaints to the front desk did no good.

Summary Heading: Sufficient, but didn't wow me at all...
Summary: Ok, if you have read ANY of my reviews you will pick up on the fact that I am not a chronic "hotel hopper" that stays in their hotel room for the majority of my trips.  On the contrary, I usually like to get out as MUCH as possible, usually trying to spend the LEAST amount of time in my room.   This being said, I still like something better than a roof over my head and a clean bed. Trust me, I know what luxury is and I can critic an over the top 5 star facility just as well as I can an eco-lodge.    So how did this hotel pan out? It wasn't as good as I had expected. The room size was nice and yes the location is great because you're just a 2-3 minute drive to anywhere in SC, but I wasn't too impressed with the overall condition of the room or the facility.   Things weren't just

Summary Heading: Relaxing, good location, close to beach
Summary: We were unable to make a two (2) day reservation at another hotel in San Clemente and decided to try the Best Western Casablanca Inn on a whim.  This turned out to be a good decision!   This is a very affordable hotel that is close to the beach and several excellent restaurants.   Besides the great location, three (3) things immediately got our attention: well landscaped and well kept grounds, friendly staff and very nice rooms.   The beds, pillows, linens are what you would normally find at a 4 star hotel.  I frequently travel and have to admit that this was probably the most comfortable bed I have slept in.   There is a nice gated private area behind the hotel with a pool and a hot tub for guests to use.  The continental type breakfast was fair with the typical cold and hot

We came to San Clemente after few days of hiking in the mountains to relax for another couple of days on the ocean before going home. We found that the oceanfront hotels were way too expensive for us so we looked for the hotels that are few minutes of walk from the beach and found the Best Western hotel, which was 10~15 minutes of slow walking from the ocean. This was the right choice because for reasonable money we got a very good room with a balcony, and breakfast was included. The breakfast was so-so but the room was excellent. We asked for a quiet room with a better view and the room was exactly the one we were looking for. Overall, we were very happy with the hotel. The room was clean, the service was excellent.

I stayed here for two nights in October with my better half.  Room size- excellent.  Cleanliness: Excellent.  Employees were very friendly.  Hotel had good ambiance for being a Best Western.  I got an agent rate and it was appreciated.  Bed was super comfy.  Pool and jacuzzi are small but not a big deal.  Super clean shower and jet stream tub (which I used).  Trust me, this BW is MUCH nicer than the days inn I saw down the street and other places.  Great for short trip or business.  The only negative were the thin walls.  San Clemente is wonderful and I will return one day.  Several great places for breakfast, lunch dinner all within walking distance.  If you like mexican cuisine, highly recommend La Siesta.  Devine.

Hubby & I decided to take a 3-day (9/6 - 9/8) get-a-way and take a friend with us since he "never goes anywhere."  Found the BW very easily.  We had never been to San Clemente before and found it to be very nice with a nice Pier (& restaurant on the Pier), a nice walking trail all along the beach, lots of shops & restaurants AND the Amtrak and Metrolink trains run right along the beach and best of all could not hear their whistles from the BW Casablanca Inn during sleeping hours.  The BW provided a minimal breakfast (cereal, toast, bagels, muffins, fruit, hard boiled eggs, juice, tea & coffee). Beds were very comfy & the flat-screen TV's have great reception.  Friend had a connecting room.  Has an OK pool & small work-out room.  It's about a 5-min ride to the Pier and bring lots

Older hotel in walking distance to the beach and pier in San Clemente.  Room was clean and comfortable.  Pool area and courtyard with fountain were very well maintained.  This is a "no frills" property, but again very comfortable.  Rooms were right under a hundred dollars a night which is a great price for a decent hotel in Orange County.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  I would stay again.

Stayed there for two nights the week of 8/15/2011.  Had a great stay in one of the rooms overlooking the interior patio (room 220). It looks like the room was recently updated with an all new spacious bathroom.  Nothing fancy, just a good clean place to spend the night with a simple free breakfast and excellent free parking.  Very quiet and the staff was most accomadating. Not really close to the beach, and no beach views, but who cares when you're spending the day at the beautiful San Clemente beach near the pier. Great place for a family vacation. Downtown San Clemente on Del Mar street has many good restaurants and make sure to stop into Billy's Deli. Also close to Dahoney and Dana Point. Make a trip over to the Ritz Carlton where you have free access to the beach and a great
The place was nice and clean. The satff were helpfull and friendly specialy Katerina. We enjoyed staying there and for sure we will go there again. Price and quility was very good.

Summary Heading: Review of Best western Casablance Inn
Summary: This is average hotel, no issues, front desk help full, front desk area small, hotel location is good, room are good, beds are good, breakfast descent, no issue. I would recomond it if you are in the area

We picked the hotel for the location and we were not disappointed. Right on the Coast Hwy, great access to I-5, close to San Juan Capistrano, Dana Point, and not too far from Laguna. Nothing really within close walking distance. We had a king deluxe on the second floor (yes there is an elevator), and the room was very spacious. We were told that the regular rooms are not as spacious.Great bathroom, very nice furnishings, nice flat screen tv, very clean, good a/c. No view, but that was okay. Close to the beach and the train station. Close access to the pool and breakfast room. Plenty of parking, but some spots are a little tight.  Fantastic check-in staff, very friendly. accommodating, and helpful. The breakfast buffet was okay, but there is a bakery across the street if you want

Stayed for 5 nights at the BW Casablanca in a King Suite with a sofa bed for our children.  Room was very spacious.  Staff even provided us with extra chairs so we could enjoy meals together in our room - we used the desk as our dining table.  Room had a mini-kitchenette as well; 4 cup coffee maker, mini fridge, sink & microwave.  Would be VERY handy to have utensils, plates, cups, etc. in the suite rooms.  We used paper cups & plastic cutlery for meals.  Bed was very comfortable, linens good quality too.  The A/C ran cool, not super icy cold - which was fine.  The pool area is clean and well kept; plenty of padded lounge chairs and tables for everyone.  It never felt crowded either.  This hotel is about a 3 block walk to the north beach area.  My 3 year old did the walk okay -

I stayed there and the rooms where nice and hotel location was great.... but as far as customer service goes I will NEVER EVER STAY THERE AGAIN... what hotel isn't open... I left my room to re-book another night and accidently left my key in the room and I go to the office no one there and doors are locked and no one answering phones I was stuck outside at 3am for 3 hours.... completely not OK never will I stay there again.

Summary Heading: A great and affordable place close to San Diego and Los Angeles!
Summary: The Hotel is older yes but is well maintained. The staff is very accomidating as well. The pool is very nice and very large. Very quiet will definatly be back in Feb next year.

Summary Heading: GO AWAY IF YOU WANT SLEEP!!
Summary: I wish I had had the sense to review TRIP-ADVISOR before booking.  The website seriously is another property.  Everything about our one night stay was AWFUL.  The room next to us was full of people partying and carrying on until 4am.  I tried over and over to call the front desk, which was unmanned the entire evening -- not acceptable!  I had to call the room myself and ask them to keep it down, which of course went no where.  The bottom sheet on the mattress wasn't even a fitted sheet, so by the morning we were literally on the mattress itself -- ewww.  Pillows 1" thick.  DON'T STAY HERE!

This is a great place to stay with large rooms and a nice pool. It close to LA or San Diego and very close to the beach. Would recomend staying in the suites they offer a small kitchenette which is nice for eating lunch or something. The Pool is large and heated and the hot tub is nice too. Breakfast is really good and the staff is more than accomidating.

Summary Heading: Better than average extras, rooms better than average.
Summary: I know my title is a little ambivalent, but we liked the place, we being my mom (in one room with a king sized bed) and me and my son in another room with two queen sized beds.  We were there for 3 nights, right at the end of October 2010.  The king room had an upgraded desk chair and seemed comfortable. The room with the two queen sized beds was plenty comfortable. Both rooms had upgraded bedding (upgraded from the average type of mo/hotel i've stayed in recently) with every bed having a lot of pillows (like, 6 pillows on each queen bed). Both rooms had nice wide-screen TV monitors and were in great shape.  Clean, no problems there. Only room "problems" were the automated light switches they had. They were good/bad... they'd come on when you walked by (good/bad depending) and

Summary Heading: Casablanca: You get what you pay for
Summary: Reasonable priced at less than $130 per night, including breakfast and free parking.  The breakfast area was very clean with a full time attendant.  The food choices were dry cereal, instant oatmeal, fresh fruit, hard boiled eggs, eggo waffles, toast, muffins, bagels/cream cheese, peanut butter, jelly, danish, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, and canned juices.  The rooms do not have views, and many require updating.  Some of the rooms have balconies, but again no ocean view.  Our room included a small refrig, micro and coffee maker.  We did have a plumbing issue in the shower when the water temperature turned scalding whenever a toliet was flushed near our room.  Upon check out we reported the issue and hope it is corrected before re-renting.  Although the hotel is on a main street,

Had not travelled in that area before, and needed a place to stay for a night. This hotel was fine. Folks at front desk were nice and helpful (got early checkin and late checkout). Parking was fine. Room was pretty large, as was bathroom. Pool area a little small and disappointing, with noise from street making it tough to relax. Breakfast room was too full to sit down, so had to sit in outside courtyard...which was a bit inconvenient since they did not provide trays. My biggest complaint is that I could not get wifi in my room....had to sit in lobby or outside courtyard.  Location is Ok..short walk to beach. But of course this means more fog in morning than if you are further inland.

What a pleasant surprise this hotel was! My 19 year old daughter and I stayed there for 2 nights and had a great time! The hotel was nice, and clean and had comfy beds, pillows, etc. The ONLY problem with the room was the carpet had just been cleaned and it hadn't fully dried out. The wonderful guy at the front desk took care of me, gave me a discount for my next stay without even asking! great customer service, David!!!   Some other lazy guest had to crap in the pool and that was unfortunate but not the hotels fault.... the bathroom is 15 steps away! They had to close the pool for health reasons, but you are right by the beach, so no biggie.   I will be back, I loved the hotel! The balcony was nice, and it looked down on the nice courtyard with water fountain.

Summary Heading: Nice place in an odd town.
Summary: I didn't know what to make of San Clemente when I arrived. "Your all in one resort" the brochure in the hotel lobby claimed. Not sure about that.  The hotel is one of the better looking ones in San Clemente. The beach is hard to see at first, but is a quick 5 minute walk away. The parking is good - it felt a bit like a fortress, I wasn't at all worried about leaving my suitcase in the trunk. Checking in was busy, but pleasant - the staff are very friendly and cheerful. There's a little fountain in the courtyard, and an average pool at the back of the hotel as well.  My only gripe about the hotel is that I went down to get breakfast for my room at 9.20 (expecting normal 7 – 10 breakfast times), and brought my girlfriend’s stuff up first. I went back down at about 9.25 to get my

Summary Heading: The staff at this place are like no...
Summary: The staff at this place are like no other. Felt like I was at a five star hotel. I have nothing bad to say about my stay. They really strive for excellence in everything they do. And the peaceful gardens in courtyard were my favorite... Constantly playing sounds of birds and wilderness. And finally you're right next to ocean..

Summary Heading: I should start with the positives. The...
Summary: I should start with the positives. The location was good & the staff was very nice. We wouldn't normally stay in a three star hotel, but it was just for one night. We have never traveled with our pets, and needed a hotel that took large dogs.  We were told they allowed pets in certain ground floor rooms.  We were assured that the rooms were very clean, and that the carpet was cleaned whenever a pet stayed in a room. That sounded good, but we didn't realize that it also meant that the carpet in the room would be wet. Yuck. The pet rooms have not been updated at all. The interiors though technically "clean" feel dirty because they are old and dingy.  Also ground floor meant, surround by the parking lot. Which means the sound of car doors closing, car alarms, people laughing,

The noisiest hotel I've ever stayed in. Anyone who likes a firm bed will love these, as comfortable as sleeping on the floor. Front desk staff needs improvement. Vending machines are out of order and no detergent in laundry room, the office didn't have any either.

I left an inferior hotel 2 nights into my weeklong stay. I was welcomed and felt truely taken care of at this hotel. I read reviews and gave it a try anyway. Very happy, and will stay here again. Oh, call the front desk for the best price!

We had a great stay here . Great location short walk to the beach and a great little walk to Del Mar Ave were all the action is . We had a great view of the ocean and the rooms are nice and big . Cool little private pool are and a nice quaint court yard . We thought this was a great value as well . We will be back . One note don't expect a whole lot of service and personality at the desk . They leave you alone thats for sure and thats not a bad thing ...

Ended my California road trip here for 3 days. great stay. North Beach is an easy 5 minute walk from hotel. Big clean rooms, quiet, good value and great staff. Nice courtyard to relax in, pool and breakfast in the morning. What else do ya need.

Summary Heading: The lighting made this room so dingy it felt like a soviet-era interogation room
Summary: The location is close to the beach.......but:  There is not enough on-site parking, we had to park on the street across from the hotel. The door to the room had no sound-proofing so you heard everyone in the hall, plus the horrible hall light leaked around it right to the head of the bed.  The in-room lighting is HORRIBLE. Every single bulb was the dingiest, blueish, depressing fluorescent. YUCK!

The Casablanca Inn was a great deal, for the price, with its close location to the beach. The front desk people were very friendly and helpful. All rooms are non-smoking, so that is good. My only complaint is that smoking is allowed everywhere outdoors at the hotel; from the pool, to the beautiful courtyard. The rooms were clean and smoke free, so that is good, but the place should take the next step and make the outside areas smoke free too.

I stayed here a few years ago and it was a bit rundown and the service was so-so, but not this time. My room was large and clean. The person who checked me in called the room after I had been there about 20 minutes to make sure everything was OK. The beds were very firm, but comfy, with white down comforters instead of tacky motel bedspreads. There was a whirlpool bath. There is a free breakfast, just bagels, cereal, fruit and such, but everything was very fresh.  I paid $80 for one night through AAA.  The motel was very quiet. I could hear a large party right below me when I opened the bathroom window, but once I'd closed it I couldn't hear them at all. I was not awoken by voices or slamming doors (I just hate loud slamming hotel doors).  I did not pay extra for an "ocean"

My boyfriend and I planned a romantic getaway for the weekend and had checked this hotel out online. It seemed nice enough. Upon arrival in the evening, we were greeted by the hotel desk worker and given the room keys. The room was nice enough - very clean. We even had a jacuzzi tub (which we payed extra for). However, that is where the fairytale ends. The view from the room "claiming to be an ocean view" was hardly that - we overlooked the rather unsightly view of powerlines, parking lots, and a backside of a building... we could see a line of ocean if you looked really closely. Our room was across the way from the banquet hall... which happened to be hosting a kids birthday party. Which was fine except for all of the noise associated with it (e.g. kids screaming, running down

We stayed 2 nights in a queen deluxe room.  The room had its good and bad points.  Good - double sink separate from the nice jacuzzi tub and toilet, counter with bar-type sink, microwave, and minifridge  Bad - entirely too much space was wasted in the entry way and vanity area, bedroom area itself was rather small, window looked directly out to the rear end of the vehicles parked outside.  Fortunately the rooms seem to be well sound proofed because a wedding party was overstaying their welcome in the banquet room above us.  The manager had to call the police to get them knock off the celebration and get back to their rooms.  I guess they thought they were the only ones staying there that night.  Upon checkout the manager gave me a $25 gift card to use for my next Best Western

Great location, very clean, good price.  What more can I say.  If you want to be near the beach, (about 3 blocks); want a clean large room to sleep in (comfortable beds) and have it be affordable, this is the place for you.  my wife & I would stay here in an instant if we were going to want to spend a day or two at the beach.

I was impressed at first with this hotel. It was clean and for the price an OK hotel. I was traveling alone ( I am a 28 year old female) and made sure to lock the top lock of the hotel door before I fell asleep. At around 4 in the morning a man opened my hotel room door using a hotel key and attempted to enter my room. Because I had the top lock, he was unable to get in and gave up after a minute or two.  I reported this to the hotel and left several messages with the manager and never heard back. I would not recommend this hotel due to major safety issues  that allowed a random man access to a hotel room where a female was sleeping alone. it is not worth this risk, find a different place to stay!
Manager Response: I do apologize to the guest for the issues she had while staying here.  Around 8am (not 4am) our laundry man was making his rounds collecting the towels and linens from the guest rooms.  Unfortunately he mistook this room for being checked out and tried to enter the room.  Once he saw a guest was present he promptly shut the door.  I have held a meeting with my staff and reminded them to announce themselves and knock 2 times before ever entering a guest room even if they believe it to be empty,  We will continue to strive offer excellent accomodations, and use issues like these to help improve our property.  General Manager Best Western Casablanca Inn

Summary: We stopped here for the night on our way back from San Diego to L.A. and thought it was a cute place. We liked the size of the room and how clean it seemed to be and the location was wonderful. The staff was great but I was only a little disappointed when I noticed a disgusting stain near the sink in our room. My children were glad to know that the pool stayed open until 11 p.m. and that it was heated so it was easy for them to enjoy a night time dip. The  hotel states that it offers feminine products but upon inquiry it was only a females razor they offered. So if you forget something it is ok because there is a 7 eleven and a Riteaid down the street. Overall we had a great stay and they have a wonderful continental breakfast. They even have the staff in the conference room

Summary Heading: A great Little hotel in a beautiful beach community
Summary: My daughter and I stayed here for six days in mid-March 2008 and really enjoyed it.  It has a pleasant courtyard, a nice pool/spa area, a good continental breakfast, and lovely bed linens. Our room was clean and large, and the staff was very pleasant.  The location gave great access to local attractions - loved the beach down the street, while shopping and the pier were just a short drive.  The Raindow sandal store is at the end of the street and a must stop for great flip flops.  It was close to the freeway for trips to LA and San Diego as well as US 1 for trips up the coast to Capistrano, Laguana, Newport Beach, etc.  I would definitely stay here again.

My family stayed here for one night and enjoyed ourselves very much. We were greeted by a warm smile by Crystal who was very caring to our needs and she also was kind enough to upgrade our room so our five year old daughter could use a spa tub. The rooms were spacious and the beds were very comfortable. The Casablanca had a nice heated pool and spa and a good sized fitness area. We also enjoyed a complimentary breakfast of waffles, bagels, assorted fruits and juices. Overall we enjoyed every aspect of this hotel and will definitely return.

Cheap. Regular room. Nothing special. Was barely there. No view.   Pool was clean and had small jacuzzi.  Just picked this hotel because of location. Very close to the beach which is BEAUTIFUL. 5-10 min walk. But we just drove. Pier in San Clemente has great seafood! Would stay again because of price.

Summary Heading: Comfortable and close to nice beach!
Summary: Rooms were clean but did not have any view at all.  There was a small but very nice pool and the breakfast was good.  My only complaint was that there was an attendant serving some of the breakfast items so this made it a little slow.  The hotel does have a nice courtyard area for eating and there are plenty of restaurants a short drive away.  The best part of this place was that you could walk just down the street to a really nice beach.  (not the one at the San Clemente pier).  The pier is a good long walk along the beach or a short drive.  We were very satisifed at this hotel for one night in August.

It is a bit far from San Clemente city center. However, it is very close to the beach, so it is just a beach hotel. Big room, comfortable and clean. The bathroom is big and has a nice whirlpool. The staff was not so friendly and a bit dumb. It has a swimming pool but it was still closed, although it was an ok weather to go to the beach. Breakfast is poor ..... It has private parking and free wireless internet.

Summary Heading: Great Value, but beggars can't be choosers
Summary: I was in town on business for a few days, and wanted to stay near the beach, but on a budget. I ooked the Best Western Casablanca on Hotwire for about $143 a night. I got here, and the property looks somewhat 30s-40s era clasic on the outside. The rooms are external entry, and there' a nice courtyard in the center of the property witha fountain. The property has three floors. The rooms themselves are spartan and basic, and if you're really picky, you may be disappointed. I travel a lot and have been to some bad places, but I was fine here. The beds weren't the best I've had, but even with a bad back, they were OK. The TV worked fine, and does have pay-per-view, and the internet has worked flawlessly the 3 nights I have been here, which is unusual for a wireless setup. The only

Everything was ok.  Clean room, fairly comfortable bed, easy parking, pleasant staff upon checking in.  Just don't expect anything  fancy (and frankly, for the $107 we paid, we shouldn't expect anything fancy).  Absolute great proximity to the beach.  I practically spent my entire youth at the beach across the street and in all these years it hasn't changed.

Summary Heading: Perfect base of operations for family of 4
Summary: We wanted an inexpensive place with lots of room for a 3 night stay near Disney and Legoland but in a more interesting beach town (in case it warmed up enough to jump in the water, which it didn't.)   We were given a suite with 2 queens, pull out queen sofa, kitchenette with under-counter fridge, tons of room, 2 TVs - it was perfect. Even my messy boys could spread out without creating a hazard for my husband and me.  The early riser could go into one of the rooms to watch CartoonNetwork and let the rest of us sleep.  jacuzzi and pool made a great end of day R&R spot after standing in lines at the big parks, and San Clemente is a great little town to cruise. We really enjoyed it and will go back next time we visit the southland.   Didn't do laundry there, but with 2 washers and
An overall very satisfying experience. More than adequate room furnishings, rich, hot complimentary breakfast, fast and courteous staff responsiveness to requests. Wish more motels were like that.

Our family of 5 stayed in a suite for 2 nights in mid November.  The hotel was quite quiet with few other rooms occupied.  With a little work this hotel could be quite a gem.  The courtyard was very nice and the hotel is in a great location.  The breakfast was above average for a continental breakfast, with helpful staff working it.  The suite was roomy with 2 queens in one room and a TV.  The hide a bed in the front room was very uncomfortable, we ended up taking the mattress off the bed and placing it on the floor (which helped only a little).  Some of the sheets had blood stains, and when we asked for blankets for the hide a bed were given 2 tiny torn single blankets.  Our other complaint was that housekeeping did not replace used items (coffee, shampoos etc).  We did not get

We have stayed at the Casablanca Inn many times when visiting relatives in San Clemente. The experience this time was superior. We had one of the new rooms on the first floor, adjacent to the pool and convenient to the parking lot, breakfast room and, even the ice machine. From what I understand, the entire property has been updated along with the addition of these new rooms. Now, there is ample parking which sometimes was a problem.   Having a pool is a real plus after an afternoon at the beach. North Beach, one of our favorites, is actually within walking distance, but offers plenty of parking, a lifeguard and a snack grill.   Although meager, the breakfast has been upgraded. If you want something more substantial, there is a nice place just across El Camino Real. Walk down

Stayed for one night Monday, June 19, 2006; 2 adults/ 2 children ages 4&6 years old.  Thomas at the front desk check-in is wonderful.  Energetic, friendly and informative.    The room - large but no big thrills.  Basic room.  All rooms face a courtyard with a fountain which drowns out the street traffic.  There is nothing in walking distance for food that 2 young kids could eat.  But can walk to the beach.  7-11 store down the road.  Continental breakfast is served in the courtyard - which may have been appealing but it was a dreary misty morning and you did not want to linger.  Meager food selection.  Went away hungry.    Not the beach type area hotel I thought it was going to be.  Thought it would be more laid back since it wasn't in the L.A. city limits.  Very rushed

Upon reading the few reviews on this hotel, I decided to finally give it a shot.  My family and I stayed there from July 2-4.  At first we encountered some check-in problems, however, thanks to the hotel manager Thomas, that was very quickly resolved.  Staying at the new wing was wonderful!  It was quiet and pretty well appointed with a separate sink, microwave and food preparation area.  The hotel itself is a 5 minute walk to the beach.  Right before you hit the beach is a 7 Eleven where my 8 year old got her ICEE's. The beach itself is a bit on the rocky side and is not as nice as Hermosa or Manhattan, however, the water was pleasant enough, but watch out for those big waves!  We were so impressed by the facility that we are making it one of our yearly vacation destinations!
Relatively inexpensive for the beach ( about 3 minute's walk away), clean, friendly, decent place to stay. Staff friendly and helpful. Nice pool and jacuzzi. Highly recommended.

We stayed here for 2 nights in April on the way to San Diego.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.    The room was nice and spacious and very clean we had no problems. Lovely shower. There was some noise from the room next door, dont know if we could hear them more because there was an adjoining door to their room, but  they were just excited children who soon calmed down!!   We didnt use any facilities, breakfast looked  nice and there was a pool and spa area.  Its a great location, easy to find and close to the beach. Although the weather was not good when we were there we still mangaged to stroll along the pier and the beach and then browse the shops on the way back. Very nice mexican restaurant on the main street Avila s El Ranchito.

Just got home from a 'working weekend' at the Casablanca Inn. Just needed to get out of the house and finish up a project I've been working on. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. They even offered me an upgrade to a quieter room. View of the Pacific from the bathroom. Thank you for some peace. Clean rooms, pleasant area - nothing fancy, but very nice.

We stayed at the Casablanca on September 19, 2005.  Ours was a standard motel room--nothing fancy.  It was reasonably clean and a large enough room.  We appreciated having a sink area separate from the bathroom/shower.  There was plenty of counter space at the sink.  We had lots of hot water and a very good adjustable shower head.  However, there was mold growing on the ceiling above the shower.  The room had a microwave and a mini-refrigerator.  All night long I heard the fridge turning off and turning on.  Our beds were quite hard, but friends of ours who were staying in another room said their beds were too soft.  The beach is just a couple blocks away, and we had an enjoyable walk there in the morning.  I was disappointed in the continental breakfast.  There was no cereal

We had a very nice stay at the Casablanca. With 4 persons (2 children) the Casablanca-suite was ideal. A separate bedroom, nice kitchen, 2 televisions: everything was ok. The beach was a 5 minutes walk. The pool was hotelwise large and had a terrific spa. The free breakfast in the patio was fresh and complete.

Summary Heading: Visit the Ritz for high tea, but STAY at the Casablanca!
Summary: A small motor inn, best kept secret in the area, and a pleasant surprise.  At first, you might think it's in an odd location, but it's very quiet, close to the beach and easy access to the freeway.  No view, but a safe location.  Very large, newer, clean rooms, coffeemaker, microwave, refrigertor, cable TV with videoplayer.  Free continental breakfast next to fountain in courtyard.  Very large outdoor jacuzzi, and one of the nicest exercise rooms.    And the price is right.  Make sure to ask for the AAA discount.    If you are visiting the San Clemente / Dana Point / San Juan Capistrano area, then you should stay here.  Or if you are passing through on your way to Disneyland or San Diego. Stayed for four nights. Heated pool fine, but hot-tub disgustingly green and only serviced on third day. Rooms good, bed good, breakfast plentiful but 'plastic'.  Free parking.  Would go again, amd San Clemente is an ideal base, tho' not for kids.
The staff was very nice and the room was certainly clean; but noise coming through the thin walls and from outside made for a less than restful night.

My husband & I recently stayed at the BW Casablanca Inn.  We found the room to be comfortable & clean.  The pool area was quite nice - plenty of lounges & chairs - sauna & restrooms were right there.  The fitness center had everything needed for a great workout.  The only disappointment was the continental breakfast.  We found it quite sparse, even though we were there when they first opened.  Despite this, we would definitely stay at the Casablanca again on a return trip to San Clemente.

We stayed at the Best Western Casablanca in San Clemente over the holidays. It was, again, a very nice place. They had new furniture in the double-room that we usually stay in which made it even nicer than times before. The spa in our room was awesome. Our whole family was at this outing. My husband and our three children. They really loved it as well! We'll definitely stay again!  The Brownstone's Ken, Yvette, Malia, Elizabeth and John

Summary Heading: Perfect Location & There's A Great Jacuzzi Too
Summary: My fiance and I spent four days in San Clemente and stayed at the Casablanca Best Western.  The location is fantastic.  We strolled for a romantic walk on the beach in the evening and it only took us a few minutes to get there.  We also enjoyed the convenience of having the Continental Breakfast right on-site.  The Jacuzzi was also an added bonus for us.  The rooms are very spacious and they even offer a complimentary viewing of the movie Casablanca...not to mention the free HBO.  The staff was wonderful and we plan on going there again.Yvette Bailey and Ken Brownstone of Ventura, CA

What a nice place. They have a free continental breakfast, bagels toast rolls fruit cereal. coffee tea juice! The staff was very friendly. We came back to San Clemente a second time, and we couldn't get in here, it was full. Next time we will get back into the Casablanca!
